results.description:
Every Sunday mid-morning we meet in Queens to exchange our language skills in Mandarin Chinese and English.

Where?

Each week I will choose a different setting to meet. (coffee shop, cafe, restaurant etc.,) Sometimes we will have dim sum together while we get to know each other and practice Mandarin/English.

What?
At each session, we will have a focus topic and support each other to improve our communication skills. 

Topics will include: greetings and introductions, sports, food, travel, family etc., Don't worry if your language skills are just getting started - We all support and help each other's progress. The focus of this group is conversation to improve our speaking skills, but if anyone would like to learn to read characters, we can also do that. It's your group - bring along a notebook and pencil to review anything you like.

Who?

Chinese and English speakers all welcome!

If you don't know any Chinese or if your English needs some attention - great! You will learn very fast in our group. Advanced language learners welcome as well.
All levels and ages welcome!

RSVP Policy

Unfortunately, If members RSVP to attend a session, then are a 'no show' -  your attendance at future session will be limited. 

We all make the effort to arrive on time, prepare for the session and it is disappointing if people don't show up. If you have to change your RSVP, please do so, 24 hours before the scheduled time of the session. Thanks. :)
results.name: Queens Chinese/English Conversation Group

Educators may also utilize existingclassroom content (lesson plans, PowerPoints, year-long curriculum) in addition to curating original work. 


All of our Meetups will be FREE but will be limited in capacity and will be populated on a first-come-first-serve basis. During these Meetups educators will learn the necessary skills to build an app for their classroom utilizing their own content or by pulling content from our Content Library. Each attendee will leave with free access to their app and the SchoolBuilder Studio software in addition to a certificate of recognition stating that he/she is now a Gadget Guru who is certified to assist others with the platform.

游戏规则


胜利条件

平民方胜利条件:所有杀手死亡

杀手方胜利条件:杀手方人数大于场上剩余人数的一半

平民方:

普通平民:

topics.name: Making a Difference in the World

results.description:
Global Zero is the international movement for the elimination of all nuclear weapons. Since its launch in December 2008, Global Zero has grown to include 300 current and former heads of state, national security advisers, military commanders, and business, civic and faith leaders -- and nearly half a million citizens worldwide; developed a step-by-step plan to eliminate nuclear weapons; built and international student movement with 170 campus chapters in 25 countries; and produced a documentary film, Countdown to Zero, with the Academy Award-winning team behind An Inconvenient Truth.

Nuclear weapons have no place in the 21st century. The ability to completely annihilate populations, infrastructure and the environment doesn't make us safer or more secure. They do not address today's security needs and siphon precious financial resources from the things that do. The threat of nuclear annihilation is real. 20 years after the end of the Cold War, 1,500 nuclear weapons are still on hair-trigger alert, ready to launch in minutes and wipe major cities off the map. Nuclear weapons kill indiscriminately. They violate international humanitarian law, and do not make us safer. Any nuclear accident or attack would have catastrophic and irreversible consequences on the environment. Even a "small" regional nuclear exchange would cause a nuclear winter, which would cause a global famine, killing approximately 2 billion people. And every day, terrorists are working to build, buy or steal a nuclear weapon. In the last two decades there have been at least 25 instances of nuclear explosive materials being lost or stolen. Those threats are real, and it's scary.

Its members understand that the only way to eliminate the nuclear threat – including proliferation, nuclear terrorism and humanitarian catastrophe – is to stop the spread of nuclear weapons, secure all nuclear materials and eliminate all nuclear weapons: global zero. The movement combines cutting-edge policy development and direct dialogue with governments with public outreach, including media, online and grassroots initiatives to make the elimination of nuclear weapons an urgent global imperative.

As residents of NYC, we have and continue to be a target of terrorism. But we can take action to avoid a nuclear weapons incident! There are no insurmountable technical barriers to global zero, nor are there financial ones. The only barrier is political: it's a matter of the leaders of the nuclear powers acting with urgency and resolve. It's our job to muster the necessary public pressure and political will to make that happen - with hundreds of world leaders, Global Zero's bold campaigning, and the power of our grassroots movement we know we can reach Zero.

If you agree with me, or at the very least curious about what I'm talking about, I urge you to attend this very important conversation. Email any questions to globalzeronyc@gmail.com.

View our Youtube video, and see why Zoe Kravitz, Matt Damon, Robert De Niro, Michael Douglas, Morgan Freeman, Naomi Watts and others think this matters to people everywhere: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-HbjizKEqG4
results.name: Global Zero NYC

Monthly meetings are held, usually on the fourth Friday of the month (no meetings in July and August), at the Williamson Library, Grand Central Terminal, New York City. Visual entertainment (slides or film) is introduced by a guest presenter. Meet at the entrance to Track 23 on the upper level at 7:00 PM or 7:15 PM to be escorted to the library, which is in a secured area. Late arrivals should phone the library at (516) 660-1972. A $5.00 admission fee is charged for non-members.

The membership application can be found at: http://www.nyrre.org/PDF/Mbshp_Applic.pdf

Our photo gallery can be found at http://www.nyrre.org/Gallery/

Our email is info@nyrre.org

results.description:
New York is the city of museums (sorry Paris). But visiting them all can be a rather expensive proposition. Admission to the Whitney will set you back $22, The Asia Society $12, The Morgan Library & Museum $18, and the MOMA a whopping $25. And even if you bite the bullet and empty your wallet it might be difficult to convince your friends to join you. But worry not! Every Friday night museums across NYC stay open late and charge zero admission fees! Better yet, by joining the FRIDAY NIGHT MUSEUM FREEBEE you can visit these cultural icons with a group of folks as cheap as yourself. And the money we save can be spent on buffalo wings and pitchers of beer after the museums close. Could you ask for anything more? I think not.

Look forward to seeing everyone,

Todd

Organizer of the FRIDAY NIGHT MUSEUM FREEBEE 

who just so happens to be the organizer of the THURSDAY NIGHT GALLERY HOP

results.description:
The Mission of New Jersey City University Toastmasters

The mission of the NJCU Toastmasters Club is to provide a mutually supportive and positive learning environment in which every member has the opportunity to develop communication and leadership skills, which in turn foster self-confidence and personal growth.

NJCU Toastmasters can benefit you in the following ways:

     conduct more effective meetings

     give better presentations

     hone management skills

     work better with fellow employees

     offer constructive criticism

     accept criticism more objectively

New Jersey City University Toastmasters Club was chartered on October 2005.  The club meets weekly on the distinguished campus of New Jersey City University (NJCU)  We meet every Wednesday at 12 noon in Hepburn Hall Room 104.

Members of the club represent all four of the University's divisions.  From entry-level support staff members to senior managers with decades of work experience, these members recognize that Toastmaster's provides a wonderful opportunity for professional development.  Cultural diversity is a hallmark characteristic of Jersey City and NJCU, and this diversity is certainly evident at NJCU Toastmasters.

Membership is open to NJCU employees, faculty, students, alumni and anyone interested in challenging themselves as they grow into the speakers they want to become.  Come join us and enjoy the Toastmasters' experience.
results.name: New Jersey City Toastmasters Meetup

results.description:
This meet up is meant for people looking to further their practice in meditative yoga. The meetup provides regularly scheduled activities that lead to further advancement in breathing, inner peace, and flexibility. Those looking to alleviate injury, promote positive health during pregnancy, lose weight, regulate the body, and bring further awareness to their surroundings are more than welcome.

Services involve regularly scheduled classes out in Overpeck Park at a $15 drop in rate. Each week is given to a three day course that furthers your practice. Whether you take the initial lesson on Tuesday, the secondary lesson on Wednesday, or the tertiary lesson on Thursday, each class is designed to further your studies.

Intermediate courses will be provided in the city at a $20 rate. The $20 course is a two hour class while the $15 course may run from 1-1.5 hours. Consultations are also provided in private for $30 as well as private sessions. Courses may vary as time may be given to specific poses for thorough review.

The weekday, $15 sessions will always be held at Overpeck Park and may be cancelled due to rain. Classes are meant to promote sun during last remaining Summer weeks and may be moved to an indoor location during the colder months of the year.

Further information (contact info, etc.) is provided after joining. Come to breathe and find inner peace...
results.name: Yoga in the Palisades

Adam Alpha Omega is the men's group of KÒèx  committee (Sexuality from the *core) of  Humanity Evolution Movement.org.  KÒèx is a call-out to members of the sexuality community (LGBT-TS-SGL-Q-S) to join the conversation connecting their sexuality to humanity evolution. KÒbonee-120 is the Black men's group within KÒèx 

The vision of KÒèx is the development of a community of women and men who function from their core in the context of their sexuality (ies) so that they can make more powerful life choices. and  catalyze the transformation of the sexuality community and culture, and provide leadership in the evolution of humanity.  We have human TECHNOLOGY. We have methodology. 

 *KÒ/Core= that part of us which connects us with each other, and with the rest of the universe.

results.description:
Travel to Costa Rica the right way .
Whether you like to travel alone and or in a group , this group offers you both yet maximizing the economies of scale that group rates offers.

I have been traveling to Costa Rica continually for over 30 years , and it upsets me how many people go there and miss its majestic natural beauty, they miss connecting with the local population , miss the opportunity to more intimately get to know the culture , their great variety of fruit and vegetables , local markets ,local festivities, local restaurants.
I INVITE YOU TO VISIT COSTA RICA and feel as if you lived in Costa Rica for few days .

Over 25 % of its land set aside for conservation.
The literacy rate is above 92%.
Education is free and compulsory up to high school
Costa Rica has 58 micro-climates.
In it, it holds almost 5 % of the different forms of life of the planet in only 0.003% of the world's territory.
If you wish, you can see tropical dry forest, tropical rain forest and tropical cloud forest in one day, you can do so here but again, why hurry.
It has over 250 volcanoes, four of which are active, including Central America's most active one.
A quick and dirty on Costa Rica is the following: To the North east it is like the little amazons of Costa Rica, to the south east it is like the little Jamaica of Costa Rica, to the south west, it is like Tarzan's movies, to the North West, it is like the little California of Costa Rica.
There are 856 species of birds, which is over a hundred more than the continental US Mexico and Canada put together.
There are more butterfly species than in all of Africa.
From the capital you can drive to the Caribbean sea and to the pacific ocean in one day but again, why hurry.
results.name: Travel to Costa Rica

results.description: This meet up is for mothers of children with Autism and/or other disabilities. Many times I found myself wanting to relate to someone who has/is experiencing my same journey. We are advocates, nurses, therapists, teachers, friends mothers to our children, but we all need a moment to relax, talk, vent out and most importantly be understood. <br>I am creating a group where moms like me can meet once a week: have coffee, go to a spa, dinner, movies, talk and cry together. Though we might have great friends and family in our lives it is not the same to share our daily experiences. This group is open to any race, religion and background. I live in union county and I welcome anyone from New Jersey to be part of this new group. Together we can make each other stronger, share our resources, give advice. No judgement, no gossip, no discrimination. I look forward in meeting you all!!The location is Union but meetings will be held in different locations around Union county! Please feel free to contact me with suggestions, questions or concerns. I look forward to fun times and new friendships! #autismawareness

results.description:
Hi ladies,

I am both an introvert and a HSP and find it challenging living in a city like NY where extroversion is 'better' and people whose awareness is heightened is not necessarily a good thing. If you are an introvert or a HSP and you would like to cultivate friendships using smaller gatherings where people listen to each other as opposed to talking at each other, this is the group for you! Some ideas of meetups would be meeting at restaurants, going out for coffee, exploring new neighborhoods, movies, yoga, bookclubs, etc.

Attendance is critical to this meetup.  Please do not commit to joining this group if you are not going to participate at least once every two months.  24 hour cancellation notice is required.  Last minute cancellations and no shows without getting in touch with me prior to the event will be removed without exception.

*Please put a real picture of you when applying.  After I approve, you will be able to change your picture to something else if you wish.

results.description:
Citizens Climate Lobby (citizensclimatelobby.org) is a non-partisan group of climate activists that is creating the political will for a livable world by empowering individuals to experience breakthroughs in exercising their personal and political power.

We meet to to educate ourselves on climate issues and the legislative process, and lobby Congress to enact a specific piece of climate legislation that will grow the economy, add jobs, increase our competitiveness with China, and clean our air and water. We also engage with the media by writing letters to editors, as well as host educational events for local organizations.


Main website: https://citizensclimatelobby.org

CCL Main Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/CitizensClimateLobby

CCL Weehawken Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/CCLWeehawken

There are over 260 CCL groups worldwide.  Other groups in New Jersey are located in:

• Montclair

• Bridgewater/Somerset Hills

• Edison/Metuchen

 • Middletown/Lincroft

•  Princeton

• Atlantic City/Ventnor City

• There are also several groups in New York City
results.name: Citizens' Climate Lobby - Weehawken, NJ

To this end our goals are: To enable artists to refine the skills necessary for art-related careers.To assist non-professional artists of all ages to develop their talents to the highest levels of skill and enjoyment.To help young adults bridge the transition from secondary school to professional standing.To develop scholarship programs to insure that students may nurture and use their talents regardless of economic limitations.To collaborate with other cultural and educational organizations in programming that will expand Art Lab’s ability to serve the multi-cultural community while maintaining the integrity of its overall objectives.

This meetup group has been established to aid Art Lab to serve our purpose to offer our services to the community at large.

An ideal Meetup member of Art Lab Inc has an affinity or passion for the fine arts, or a desire to learn about or teach art. We offer many free community events throughout the year, such as, exhibition openings, demos, community arts and cultural events, as well as art classes and workshops.

results.description:
Through our work we have found far too often that many people actually have great interest in the workings of the Realty Industry but begin to feel overwhelmed when attempting to gain knowledge. Unfortunately, either they get lost in the jargon of the business, don't feel they qualify or just have been fed a slew of misinformation. The reality is, depending on the sector of Realty one may want to enter, many of us walk around already qualified to get involved as-is and just don't know it!

   We at CIG are eager to help like-minded individuals bridge this gap and build something extraordinary.  As the saying goes, network equals net worth so our goal is to not only share our resources but to also learn as much as we can from you.

 Registration to most of our events will be Absolutely FREE & Refreshments will be served. Don't worry, we also will NOT be springing options on you to pay for further use of our services or to work for our team at any time during the workshops either. These will be commitment-free, informative session meant to raise awareness into the inner workings of investment realty and CIG. The workshops will be especially useful for young professionals looking to get into Realty for the first time.
results.name: Calculated Investors

results.description:
The New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce is New Jersey's premier organization for the promotion of LGBT owned businesses, LGBT business enterprise certification opportunities (LGBTBE), and the advancement of LGBT business professionals.  

We are proud to serve as the New Jersey affiliate chapter of the National Gay & Lesbian Chamber of Commerce (NGLCC) based in Washington, DC. You should attend our networking events, workshops and panel discussions to grow your business, widen your knowledge base and expand your social circle, within the community and beyond.  Experience the power of membership. Become a chamber member today and apply for LGBT business certification.  

The NGLCC is the exclusive, third-party certification body that verifies that eligible businesses are majority-owned by LGBT individuals, and subsequently grants LGBT Business Enterprise® (LGBTBE®) designation to such businesses as part of its LGBT Supplier Diversity Initiative.  By becoming a certified LGBTBE, businesses are able to build relationships with America's leading corporations, generate prospective business and clients, and collectively team with each other for contracting opportunities. As corporate America becomes more inclusive and further diversifies its supply chain, certification offers the opportunity for LGBT-owned businesses to differentiate themselves from their competitors.
results.name: New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce

results.description:
Embrace Potential provides monthly pro bono group coaching to international students in Greater New York City.  This is a pro bono service. There will be absolutely no solicitation of paid services.

The group will be limited to six people at a time to ensure the quality of the conversation and guaranteed support to each member.. 

* Who should join: All international students. This will benefit the most junior and senior undergraduate students and graduate-level international students. 

* Why should you join: Together we create a small and intimate network of international students who strive to make the best out of their studying experience in the United States. 

* What can members expect out of the group: The purpose of this meet up group is to facilitate activities and discussion that will benefit the members. Every meetup will have a specific topic, including American networking, professional development, U.S. dating culture, connection with families at home, etc. 

* Community: You will meet like-minded international students like yourself and successful recent graduates. Between meet-ups, conversations will be ongoing via message board and mailing list. Stay connected.

Learn more about Embrace Potential, visit http://www.embracepotential.com.
results.name: International Student Coaching Group

Learn to set your camera, and utilize it; learn to see light, and control it; and learn to pose models, before you click it. Just like driving a car it becomes second nature over time, but you must practice, practice, practice! This is a free group; what I learn I like to share with others, because it helps me become a better photographer. We can all learn from each other, share tips, and support each other in our efforts to become better photographers. If you don't try, you can't fail, and if you don't fail, you can't learn. Let's get together and make it happen! Join us for events, and 1 on 1 sessions; we will be visiting various locations in NYC, as well as participate in seminars, and exhibitions. See you soon...

Live in NYC? Interested in hunting but don't know where to start? Already have your Hunting License but don't know what's next? Just trying to meet other local people with the same interests? Come join us!

As someone who has lived in NYC for most of my life, and only started hunting a few years ago, I know how difficult it can be to get started. Having grown up with a father who only used to hunt when he was younger and nobody to encourage or teach me, it took a while to get started. I created this group to help those interested in hunting be enthusiastic and overcome the hurdles that can discourage most. We'll cover a wide range of topics such as where to start with no experience, hunting regulations, firearm laws, practice, hunting tactics, finding land, etc. As well as create a place where people can meet others, pool resources, and share experiences and encouragement.

results.description:
As a father of two young children living far away from even the expanded SEC vicinity, I have a hard time finding like-minded individuals with whom to watch football as it was meant to be played. Specifically, I'm an Auburn fan, but anyone is welcome--even Bama fans. I'm envisioning mothers, fathers and children gathering to watch some games this fall.

The 3:30 games on CBS would probably be easiest. I spoke to the manager at the Applebee's in the Atlantic Terminal Mall because it's centrally located in Brooklyn, and it would be better than an actual sports bar for children. There's a space in the back he said we might be able to use if enough people RSVP. It has two flat screens and room for maybe 20 people. A couple of other spots in the restaurant look good as well for letting kids stand up and move around a little instead of being cooped up an a chair for three plus hours.

On September 5, Auburn is hosting Louisville. I've also schedule meetups for Georgia at Vanderbilt on September 12 and the game on September 19 between Auburn and LSU. Those are the only games in the sort of near future CBS has announced. We can see about other games once I determine the interest and CBS locks in their schedule.
results.name: SEC Football Families in Brooklyn

La terapia con ángeles nos ayuda a comunicarnos con los angeles y los seres de luz. Al entrar en contacto con los ángeles, se recibe guía espiritual en las áreas de la vida que inquietan o bloquean a la persona y que le impiden disfrutar con plenitud. El resultado, claridad en los ajustes a realizar, para vivir desde la armonía y el equilibrio.

La terapia con ángeles consiste en entrar en contacto con estos maravillosos y amorosos seres de luz, a través de la meditación.
5 razones para recibir terapia con ángeles

1)-Establecer contacto con tus seres de luz, para empezar a disfrutar de una vida más amorosa y plena, de la mano de ellos.
2)-Recibir consejo angelical, sobre los cambios a realizar en tu vida para mejorar en aquellas cosas que anhela tu corazón.
3)-Liberarse de creencias, pensamientos o emociones limitantes en cualquier área de la vida, que no permiten el flujo de la misma de manera armónica y que no te permiten recibir lo que tu mereces.
4)-Comprender tu propósito en esta vida, encontrando sentido y significado a tu existencia.
4)-Aprender y desarrollar una nueva mirada a las situaciones, reconociendo la divinidad que habita en ti, que te permite ser uno con Dios y con el universo

results.description:
Quick Summary:

We are looking for ambitious comedians, rapper, singers, dancers, actors, actresses, musicians, & models for our bi-weekly Youtube Web Series about bad bankers and their customers. This is a great opportunity to get noticed.  You can come on just to make a cameo appearance or be a regular ongoing member of the series.

Ideal members for our Meetup:

We are looking for ambitious members who are excited to be a part of our team.  You ideally want to produce, act, edit, be a part of, or start your own youtube channel and really like the FinQi cause. 

About the Series:

The series will be heavily promoted by FinQi, a free service provided to the community to make banks pay you & reverse all bank fees.  As a potential result of the promotion & strong story appeal to local and national media.  There is a strong possibility some of the people involved can really see a boost in their careers.    The scripts are great, we just need the right talent. This Youtube Web Series is aiming to be controversial, funny, fun, & extremely entertaining.

About FinQi:

If have an strong interest in morality and good for the overall public & prefer to spend your money on vacations, fun, & not banks you are a FinQi person.  We are not occupy wall street though.  Our aim is detailed on making banks follow our rules.  None of our members pay fees and are instead our members banks pay our members to do every day banking.  The rest of the public can get abused by big banks to the point that if you are watching it for entertainment and get a tub of popcorn you can be in for some big laughs.

If you have been an angry bank customer, ex- personal banker, ex-business banker, or financial advisor or are familiar with how the media characterizes the shady world of banking you may fall in love with us.  

If Interested:

Please send your portfolio, resume, reel, demo, photo or a link to your works or why you are interested. 

Bi-Weekly Meetups:

We will be meeting at least once every 2 weeks.
results.name: Bi-weekly FinQi Youtube Web Series

This group meets at Astoria Park (inside the running track) and practices, shares and talks about all things Capoeira. Usually meeting for 45min for usual work-out or sometimes 2hr half-picnic capoeira days.


If you are serious about learning Capoeira I can recommend a qualified instructor right in Astoria. 


In this group we are all beginners here who just like to meet and share what we know in a friendly no-stress environment.


Please join the group!.

results.description: Go Eat Give is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting peace and understanding by advancing cultural awareness through food, travel, and community service. By partnering with community organizations abroad, Go Eat Give raises global awareness of important issues and provides meaningful support to local nonprofits, including orphanages, schools, health centers, food programs, and women's empowerment centers. Go Eat Give holds Destination Dinner at consulates, cultural centers and local restaurant in New York City areas to raise awareness about a particular country. We showcase restaurants that serve authentic cuisine from the country, speakers that share knowledge of the country's customs and practices, artists that educate participants on the local culture. results.description:
After successfully organizing a great meetup for a year and a half I think I know more than ever what it is that so many of us are seeking in our new friendships. Specifically seeking women in their late 30's to around 50. There are exceptions to this rule of course as we all hit various life stages at different times. I am hoping for each of us to find friendships that lift us up, make us better, support us and celebrate all of lifes mini milestones! This is a group for women that can appreciate hanging out in one anothers homes with a glass of wine or a great dessert having amazing conversation. A group that gets to know each other so well that each of us feel safe sharing, laughing, teaching and learning. A group that encourages even the most timid of us to be slightly more adventurous. A group that can be about nothing and then about everything...trips, outdoor activities, game nights, great books, museums, potlucks, wine bars, good food, and even a little fitness.

I have included a 30 day free trial. I feel this is enough time to get a feel for us and to decide if we are for you or not. If after that 30 day trial you do decide to join, please try to remain active in the group. I know that life does ebb and flow and sometimes its easier than others but its so nice to see familiar faces and helps us want to invest in one another. It improves the quality of the meetups. I do go through periodically and delete inactive members. This has worked well in the past. 

I really hope to see each of you soon!!

results.description:
We have come to remember who we are. We have come to reclaim the power within, to live in the fullness of our true being. We have come to live in joy. My vision in gathering you all together here is not only to support our healing journeys with sacred plant medicines but also to bring what we have learned and remembered via these journeys back to the real world, to our everyday lives. In my eyes this work is about coming to a place where we find the ceremony in our everyday life, in every step, every moment, every word, and every thought, with or without the medicine.

Those with any experience in this world of plants and shamanism have heard the word “integration” and how important it is in this work. But what does “integration” mean? How do we integrate and apply our inner wisdom to the happenings around and within us? How do we dissolve the seeming separation between the world of spirit and the “real world”?

I am here simply to share with you my knowledge and experience and to create safe, sacred space for each of you to reconnect to the medicine/answers/wisdom/truth within yourselves and with each other. I offer you a connection to a community of like-hearted beings who are offering their wisdom and tools to advance the whole on this path of awakening.

I believe in transparency and honesty because we all carry the medicine within. Each of us has a unique and equally important gift to offer. Everyone has vision. Everyone holds a special space in the circle of ceremony, in the larger circle that is Life.
There are no secrets on the path to awakening. There is only truth, and that truth is for everyone to share.

I envision a life for myself and others where we wake up each day feeling connected, guided and at ease. Feeling real and true to who we are and what is passing through us. Feeling clear and with a sense of purpose.
I envision a life of being awake. Awake all the time, not just when working with the medicines. Living the awakeness to the Truth. The Truth that: I AM Whole, I AM Love, I AM Free. 

What will be offered?: 

-We will come together as a community to learn about and share our experiences with sacred plants and to share our work and gifts with others.  This can happen both online via webinars and in-person via live events and workshops.
-Webinars to prepare participants before medicine ceremonies so they feel grounded, open and at ease before arriving at the ceremony. We will do group meditations, review the preparation recommendations and ask questions to express and clear up any potential confusion or concerns.
-Webinars to integrate after the ceremonies. We will do group meditations, share our personal experiences, offer tools and exercises that can be done daily to assist the unfolding of what you experienced with the medicine, and answer any questions participants may have.
-Alternate resources that have powerful healing tools that can be practiced daily to continue the awakening process in our everyday life or between the ceremonies.
-Opportunities to connect one-on-one or in a group setting to catalyze personal healing.
-Access to virtual and live events all over the United States and Canada.
-Access to shamanic and energy healing practitioners.
-Access to educational information about healing plants, foods, and products.
-A place to be heard, seen, and supported.

Who am I?
My name is Rachael Devon Rios Sessions. I have come to this work via my own transformational journey and self-seeking. I began my work with the medicine about 6 years ago. I dove in head first after my first ceremony experience, which awakened within me an undeniable knowing that my work with sacred plants was much bigger than my own. I have worked with many wonderful teachers, but my most profound teachers to date have been my late-husband Ramon Orlando and our two beautiful boys, Rafael and Rey. Ramon passed away suddenly in his home country of Colombia last year but continues his work as shaman and taita (teacher) from the world of spirit. We shared many dreams for the expansion of the work with these sacred tools as a vehicle for the awakening of every being. I aim to humbly continue the work we began together and I trust in the guidance and vision I am offered. Besides being a full-time mama, I am a facilitator and organizer of sacred ceremony as well as a shamanic practitioner, Reiki master, yoga teacher and BodyTalk practitioner.
results.name: AYAM Healing with Plants

results.description: Prema is the Sanskrit word for divine or unconditional love. This Meetup is structured as a satsang, or spiritual meeting, for those interested in exploring contemporary approaches to spiritual growth and development. Each Meetup will involve some combination of meditation, mantra, and prayer and discussion of contemporary spiritual teachings by Mata Amritanandamayi (Amma), Mirabai Devi, Eckhart Tolle, Neale Donald Walsch, Paul Selig, Marianne Williamson, and others. The goal is to promote an understanding of how we can develop unconditional love for ourselves and for all humanity. Spiritual growth never happens in isolation -- only by working with others.

results.description:
As a child, I spent much of my life outdoors.  Whether in a backyard or campground, many of my fondest memories have something to do with being outside.  Now with a family of my own, I cant help but notice how much time our digital devices consume us on a daily basis.  Don't get me wrong, I'm a self proclaimed tech junkie.  Like many of you, my cell phone is attached to my hip, whether for professional or personal reasons.

I created this Meetup to encourage people to reconnect with the great outdoors. So if you are into hiking, biking, geocaching, fishing, camping or anything else that involves being outside, you'll find someone here with similar interests. Activities will be appropriate for beginner and intermediate levels.  We won't be cliff jumping off the Grand Canyon (yet).  This is a family friendly Meetup, so if you have kids, please bring them along too!

You do not have to be from the West Essex region to join us.  In fact, we encourage outsiders to join us and introduce us to some of their local gems!

This Meetup is family run.  We are not a company and are not affiliated with any company.  Sponsor's have agreed to assist us with our Meetup and event fees in return for promotional visibility.
results.name: West Essex Outdoor Adventure Club

results.description:
This is a group for people who love all things Italian... enough to actually travel to Italy.  And not just the Rome/Florence/Venice triumvirate (though I visit and love all those cities).  I'm talking about UNDISCOVERED Italy... the destinations that are not so common, but oh, so amazing...

We'll be developing trips and opportunities for cultural exchange that are off the beaten path. Rome, Florence and Venice are wonderful, but there are so many other interesting, beautiful and delicious destinations to explore. 

You should join this group if you're serious about participating.  And likewise, if you plan to click "Join" and never do a thing about it, then you should probably pass us by.  I've organized a number of Meetup groups, and the biggest problem is lack of accountability among members.  In this group, if you RSVP but never follow up, or if you ignore communications that are directed at your personally, you will not be allowed to continue in the group. Sorry to be a hard ass, but it's not fair to the group to carry dead weight.

The good news it that some members are amazing, and we've been able to create some amazing experiences here in Italy.  As a result, I actually live in Italy for a good part of the year, and I'd love it if more Americans discovered some of the wonderful places and people that have drawn me to this amazing country! Join us... it will be a great adventure.
results.name: Americans Exploring Italy: Culture, Food, Friendship & More

results.description:
This is an accountability group for business owners that are looking for support to help achieve their latest goals for growth.

Guidelines:

1.  Each member should choose and commit to a discreet and measurable goal for each quarter. The goal should follow the SMARTER guideline:

S - Specific

M - Measureable

A - Actionable

R - Relevant/Realistic

T - Time Bound (3 months)

E - Ethical

R – Resourced


2.  Each member must commit to bi-weekly in person meetings and alternate weekly phone bridge communications.


3.  Each member must be read to actively participate and contribute to the group.
results.name: New York Business Accountability Group Meetup

results.description:
Football for Change (F4C) is a 3v3 recreational football (soccer) league, a social movement and business dedicated to use football as a tool for change with the ultimate goal of creating an alternative to FIFA.  Right now, we are looking for captains of teams for the first 3v3 league of F4C in Brooklyn at the Prospect Park to start on September 13th. Meanwhile, we are meeting for free pre-season games sessions.

The league will run for at least 8 weeks. It is planned to have at least 8 teams with 6 players each, who play on Sundays two 25-mins games. Besides the game, team members and friends will be encouraged to support a suggested social cause and engage in an after-game conversation about social impact and other topics of interest.

EVERYBODY is welcome!

This is the deal for this season: team of 6 players + 14 games in 8 weeks + social impact = $500

Includes: NYC Parks permit, soccer balls & goals 

Our core value is trust, we believe it is the foundation of a strong society. F4C's finances will be published for transparency and educational purposes. 

If you want to become a captain or register your team for the F4C's Brooklyn league, you can make your payment through Paypal to change4football@gmail.com

As part of our sales strategy there will be advertising efforts to find players for the league, however there is a special superpower in the word of mouth that makes it the most powerful marketing technique. Let's make this happen!

Connect with us on Facebook & Twitter, spread the word!

 See you in the field.-

Loló & Leo
results.name: Brooklyn Sundays 3v3 Soccer League

Women on Course is a one-of-a-kind group that connects like-minded women through business and social networking events, on and off the golf course. Whether you’re flirting with the game or already involved, Women on Course invites you to enjoy all the benefits the golf lifestyle has to offer. You don’t have to spend five hours on the course to take advantage of the networking and social benefits golf has to offer, join us on the 1st Tee or at the 19th Hole and know that a good time will be had by all who attend!

More than golf, Women on Course emphasizes fun and friendship at our Signature networking events and golf outings. Join us for a luncheon, a golf lesson or our wildly popular "9 & Wine" events where you can play a quick 9-holes and then enjoy a glass of wine in the clubhouse with your new friends. results.description:
The purpose of our group is to encourage it's members to live a “regret-less" life.

Are you stuck in a rut?  Cant forgive someone?  Not getting over your last breakup?

At Y'NEVANO meeting and events, the conversations encourage you to practice living with a "You never know" state of mind.  What if you act on your ambitions, position yourself to hit your targets and adopt the spirit of an achiever? Because, Y'NEVANO.

Comedians Wali Collins and Annie Gambina have teamed up to facilitate fun, impactful, interactive workshops.  Enjoyable exercises and conversations demonstrate how to handle stress, be happier and live without regrets.

Wali Collins, Author, Comedian, Actor:  Working as an Architect, the calling for show business was very strong.  Wali’s mother encouraged him to pursue stand-up comedy and gave him the best piece of advice. She simply said, "you never know."

Wali Collins is a regular at all of the main stream Comedy clubs in the United States.  He has traveled the world, hosted TV shows, and had the honor of performing for two American presidents.  Wali is also the most sought after comedian for corporate events.  Wali has succeeded at all facets of life.  He feels a responsibility to share Y’NEVANO with the world.

Annie Gambina, Trainer, Life Coach, Comedian:  Having spent her career in the field of training and personal development, Annie has facilitated workshops for children as young as 4 through adults in retirement in areas such as personal productivity, stress management, forgiveness and abduction prevention, just to name a few.  Her  passion is to have people she comes in contact with realize how they are special and unique and to uncover hidden talents.
results.name: Y'NEVANO Achievers & Doers

This group is for those who want to take 100% responsibility for their own health. It is for those who are sick and tired of being sick and tired. If you are interested in a self-directed approach to your own healthcare, this is the place for you. 

       There are healthcare providers everywhere who cure "incurable" diseases hundreds an thousands of times a year. They can reproduce their results anytime with virtually anyone. We are here to expose you to some of them and their knowledge. If you or a loved one have a particular medical condition and want a different opinion and perspective, join our group.

       We offer no medical advice and have nothing to sell, but we are here to discuss perspectives of health and talk about different opinions that alternative healthcare practitioners have. 

       Our group learns from one another and supports each other. We are here to exchange ideas and share experiences of what works for us and what does not. Some member may know of accomplished alternative healthcare practitioners with a great track record. Others may know websites that have specific information that another member may need.

       We are here to facilitate conversation and exchange ideas for the benefit of all. Feel free to go into our  "Discussion" section for a better idea of what we are about.

Thank you.
results.name: When Traditional Medicine Fails -- North Jersey

First, we only speak and listen Chinese in the meetup. I won't speak English to you unless you ask me to use English explaining Chinese.  

Second, the organizer will prepare Chinese reading for you. The reading will include Chinese and English translation. Also, I will pick out some important vocabularies and write down how to pronounce correctly. You can read the article and listen my record at home first and then come to meetup. Each weak, You will have a different topic to practice and discuss with every members. After we finish our topic, we can have a casual talk! 

Third, There is a upper limitation of 7 members who can attend the meetup because I want to prove that every members have enough time to speak Chinese.

results.description:
We practice mindfulness meditation and principally follow the Zen tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We also explore the wisdom from other wonderful teachers.

Cultivating mindfulness means paying attention to what is going on inside of us and around us. Too often we live in forgetfulness - our body is in one place but our mind is lost somewhere else. When we bring mindfulness into our everyday life - to our thoughts, emotions, speech and actions - we are able to embrace all aspects of ourselves, better able to deal with anger and other negative emotions, and can experience life more fully.

www.facebook.com/SunOfAwareness

We meet regularly on Sunday mornings, 9:00-10:30am, at Yoga Shunya studio: 275 Grove Street, 3rd Floor (across from City Hall).

Beginning meditators - and those with no experience - are always welcome. Donation is optional ($5-10 suggested) to support the yoga studio. Cushions, mats, and chairs are all provided. Just wear comfortable clothes for sitting and walking!

Come whenever you can -- We'd love to meet you!

==========================================================

Note: While our group is new on Meetup, we have been gathering regularly since 2009. And now we're focused on letting more people know about us!
results.name: Sun of Awareness - Mindfulness Meditation in Jersey City

results.description:
WHY TOASTMASTERS? 

Today’s business environment is more competitive than ever. Technical skills no longer determine who sets the pace. It’s strong communication and leadership skills that will push you to the front of the pack. 

These are skills you can refine as a member of a Toastmasters club. And best of all, since it is a mutually supportive and positive learning environment, protective gear is not necessary.

Give your career a boost - join Toastmasters today! Stay ahead of the pack!


WHAT IS 730 TOASTMASTER CLUB? 

We are a local New York Toastmasters Club - part of the broader Toastmasters clubs family. We operate under the same high Toastmasters International standards and deliver a great, fun, save environment to practice your public speaking. We usually meet at TIAA-CREF location on 730 Third Avenue in New York - a short walk from Grand Central. We meet four times a month, the 2nd and 4th Tuesday from 5:30-6:30 every other week and the 1st and 3rd Thursday from 12:05-1:05. 

You can test-drive the experience as a guest at first and determine if is something you want to commit to by joining the Toastmasters as an official member. 

The events currently on the calendar will be posted in the community. Please sign-up for those you can make it so we can plan for the space and track attendance. 

For more information please email: Toastmasters_NY@tiaa-cref.org 


WANT MORE INFO? KEEP READING

What is Toastmasters?

No, we don't make toasters!

From a humble beginning in 1924 at the YMCA in Santa Ana, California, Toastmasters International has grown to become a world leader in helping people become more competent and comfortable in front of an audience. The nonprofit organization now has nearly 270,000 members in more than 13,000 clubs in 110 countries, offering a proven – and enjoyable! – way to practice and hone communication and leadership skills.

Most Toastmasters meetings are comprised of approximately 20 people who meet weekly for an hour or two. Participants practice and learn skills by filling a meeting role, ranging from giving a prepared speech or an impromptu one to serving as timer, evaluator or grammarian.

There is no instructor; instead, each speech and meeting is critiqued by a member in a positive manner, focusing on what was done right and what could be improved.

Why Join?

Survey after survey shows that presentation skills are crucial to success in the workplace. Many people pay high fees for seminars to gain the skill and confidence necessary to face an audience. Toastmasters’ provides an option that is less expensive and held in high regard in business circles. This organization has been around for more than 84 years and offers a proven – and enjoyable – way to practice and hone communication and leadership skills.

You will…

·  Learn to communicate more effectively 

·  Become a better listener. 

·  Improve your presentation skills 

·  Increase your leadership potential 

·  Become more successful in your career 

·  Build your ability to motivate and persuade 

·  Reach your professional and personal goals 

·  Increase your self confidence.

How you do it.

·  Build speaking and leadership skills with time-tested methods 

·  Focus on areas of interest in our self-paced curriculum 

·  Receive suggestions for improvement through constructive evaluations

Toastmasters programs are . . .

·  Inexpensive 

·  Interactive 

·  Convenient 

·  Friendly 

·  Supportive

More than four million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?

Become a Member

Come see us in action – visit a local Toastmasters club!  730 Toastmasters

Email:  Toastmasters_NY@tiaa-cref.org

·  Each group has a different personality – you may wish to visit more than one.  Go to http://www.toastmasters.org/ and use the “Find a Club tool” to find meetings near you.  Call or e-mail in advance (if possible) to confirm meeting time and location.

Ready for the next step?

·  After you attend a meeting, you can apply for membership (minimum age 18.)

·  At the meeting, ask for a membership application.

·  Membership is affordable and if you are an employee of TIAA-CREF, some of the dues are covered through your total benefits package.

·  $20 new member fee (one time fee)

·  Toastmaster International half-year membership dues are $27 plus a one-time $20 fee for your new member kit. 

·  The VP Membership will send your application and fees to Toastmasters’ World Headquarters.

·  Your New Member Kit should arrive in the mail in about 10 days.

Toastmaster's Promise

As a member of Toastmasters International and my club, I promise...

·  To attend club meetings regularly

·  To prepare all of my speech and leadership projects to the best of my ability, basing them on projects in the Competent Communication, Advanced Communication or Competent Leadership manuals

·  To prepare for and fulfill meeting assignments

·  To provide fellow members with helpful, constructive evaluations

·  To help the club maintain the positive, friendly environment necessary for all members to learn and grow

·  To serve my club as an officer when called upon to do so

·  To treat my fellow club members and our guests with respect and courtesy

·  To bring guests to club meetings so they can see the benefits Toastmasters membership offers

·  To adhere to the guidelines and rules for all Toastmasters educational and recognition programs

·  To maintain honest and highly ethical standards during the conduct of all Toastmasters activities
results.name: 730 Toastmasters Club

results.description: The Little Garden is a beginners study group of A Course In Miracles dedicated to recognizing our relationship with god through one another. Our format is structured to introduce and apply the principles and methods of A Course In Miracles in our daily lives. To uncover the principles, we study portions of the text. To apply them, we practice workbook lessons. Each week, we meditate using a workbook lesson, and then study a principle or a workbook lesson, alternating between text and lessons. results.description:
A crisis continues today in both the New York Courts as well as in the legal services provider community! Thousands of Civil and Supreme Court litigants continue to be unable to find or afford counsel and must appear pro se, without the competency to represent themselves. Moreover, the pro bono legal services provider community is unable to handle the enormous volume of litigants seeking representation. That this shortage of staffing is occurring at the same time that thousands of lawyers are unemployed deserves attention and a solution. Therefore, in order to help address the above structural representation and employment challenges,

917Lawyers Is creating and furthering a community of legal professionals for the purpose of organizing networking meet-ups to enabler participants to discover new public service, pro bono, and career opportunities. At these professionals’ only meet-ups, members will benefit from face to face networking with peers, expanding law firms and legal services providers, and gain knowledge and insight into future
employment as well as pro bono opportunities.

Our organization has programs for Beginners as well as Experienced Investors, in NY, NJ, CT, as well as 27+ locations around the country.

Right now we're in a once in a lifetime buyer's market which is helping to fuel our expansion. When else in our Lifetime, will we see the combination of Below Market property values and Record Low mortgage rates. Working with us will give you the option of Investing Part Time for residual income or Quitting your Day Job, Firing Your Boss and becoming a Full Time Investor. With the help of new technology, merchants and brands can analyze their customers’ characteristics and behaviours to engage with them within the context of their needs, desires, preferences, timing and location, to surprise and delight them and build long-lasting customer relationships.

Whether you're in search of a prospective donor or client, you need to follow best design practices to be both noticed and understood. We're founded on the simple philosophy that design needs to be considered now so you'll have a more consistent brand later. But, we get that it might not make sense to take on a huge branding project before you have the funds or knowledge of your brand to back it up. That's where we come in.

We'll give you industry-tailored tools to follow simple design practices now at a rate you can afford. (We can tackle the big branding stuff later.) It's time for smart design to meet smart business.

It's our hope that in addition to connecting you with our classes, this meetup can serve as a discussion about local resources and tools, from printers and design tools to foundation funding and incubators.

results.description:
If you're a woman career professional, a mom transitioning back into the workforce or a mom who needs support to balance work and life, a woman entrepreneur who's juggling just about all she can juggle... or a woman who simply wants to experience support and empowerment through coaching, join the NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup!

EchoesTM Coaching Circles are Directed by the group and the Facilitator in a way that is helpful to each individual. Each circle is:

• A space for learning about yourself within the context of a group and/or a team
• A space to gather relevant information about your own approach to different situations by receiving feedback from circle members
• A space to tackle hard decisions, challenging situations, and gain varying perspectives from others 
• A space to be encouraged to take steps in scary situations
• A space to obtain tools on how to communicate better through role playing and other activities 
• A space to learn techniques to transfer into your life across the spheres
• A space to decompose and recompose the emotionality behind your approach to different situations and to understand how to manage this emotionality and use it to your advantage
• A space to develop a keen understanding about boundaries and the relevance of saying “No” or “Yes”
• A space to fine-tune verbal and gestural expression, and to become comfortable with being a consummate communicator
results.name: NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup

results.description:
Toll Roads = Highway Robbery! plain and simple.

I have created a Facebook page called "Toll Roads = Highway Robbery!"

However, that page will be used for people who will support us. This meetup group here is for people who want to help make the difference. Once we have a few people, we will meetup somewhere, discuss and start planing on how to make this a powerful origination and fight off the high tolls we're being robbed on daily bases. A lot of people have told me, "don't even start, it will never happen, you can't fight them" but all I can tell you is, that I do believe that if we work as a team we could make this happen!

So feel free to join in, however, if you do not want to be involved in arranging, then at least support us by liking our page on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/TollRoadsisHighwayRobbery Some people ask, "how do you expect to pay for those Tuneless, Bridges and Highways without collecting tolls?"

The answer, think about it. We pay Tax for a reason! now if you where to say that there is not enough money left to pay for those roads, then what is Tax made for?? what could be more important to use our Tax money then for our Tuneless, Bridges and Highways??

We're being Taxed on our businesses, personal income, sales tax and Tax by the pump, so why do we have to pay tax again to maintain those roads?

It is time we the people stand up and fight and take back our Tuneless, Bridges and Highways!

If not now, then wen?? Look at what is happening in NYC, it is our fault that the tolls have gone up to $14-16 at some bridges and tunnels, because we have allowed it, we didn't fight back.

Lets come together and say enough is enough! these are our roads and we pay for that with our taxes and we will not allow anymore tolls to be collected at all! not even a single penny!
results.name: Toll Roads = Highway Robbery Meetup

results.description:
It has been said that at their cores, psychology and acting attempt to do similar things: to understand why people unconsciously or consciously behave in certain ways. Actors must have a good grasp of the inner workings of the character they must portray and the psychological skills necessary to generate and fully inhabit roles which they may not have experienced in their their own lives. Psychology and, in particular, psychodynamic approaches (Freud, Jung, Erikson, Phillips) provide a deep understanding of emotion and behavior that can help you create more richly nuanced characters and improve your acting technique.  

This is a roundtable workshop and discussion group for actors, screenwriters, filmmakers, and others in the performing arts who wish to gain psychological insights to improve their character-building skills. At each meeting we will discuss a different emotion or aspect of the human condition in the context of psychoanalytic principles that provide insight into the fundamental drives and conflicts that direct our lives.  We will examine emotions and behaviors and relate them to character-building frameworks such as Uta Hagen’s Nine Questions, the Michael Chekhov method, Stella Adler's techniques, and conceptual frameworks such as Freud’s model of the mind. We'll share and examine our own experiences and gain insights into our behaviors and those around us. These insights, and your ability to creatively adapt them, can improve your ability to build realistic and unique characters.

Examples of topics we will cover in individual workshops:

* Greed

* Jealousy and Envy

* Stage self vs. Real Self

* Anxiety

* Depression

* Grief

* Addiction

8/28/15: Stay tuned for the date of our first workshop in mid/late-September.
results.name: Actors' Psychology Workshops

This is a social meetup group for people who enjoy and share an interest in learning about knives and the culture that surrounds knives, swords and blades from all over the world.

Knives have been a part of all mankind. Today, they are featured in stories, in movies, used for productive things like camping, utility, collecting and even martial arts.

This group will feature regular get togethers to "show and tell", to discuss different topics related to knives, talk about scenes found in different movies related to blade use, martial arts training/use if people want to discuss those topics as well.

Are you tired of living paycheck to paycheck?
Could you use more money to help pay for the things you need and want in your life?
Do you think you have the potential to make more money?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then you belong in our group. We have been working with seasoned professionals who have figured out how to make more money and want to give back to the community. Join us to tap into this knowledge and make a better life for you and your family.

One of the most important rules we have learned about making money is to share the knowledge with others to help THEM make money. The fastest way to make money is to help others make money.  We also strongly believe in the practice of tithing.  If you are helping others while making money it is not only very rewarding, but it inspires you to make MORE money to help MORE people.

There are SO many ways to make money and this is the place we will share them with you.  There is plenty of money to be made in this world.  There is no need to take advantage of others or do anything illegal.  In our group, we learn to live life abundantly because ABUNDANCE is our mindset.

results.description:
Hi everyone! I have been living in Astoria since 2012, and love it! And while I have many friends who live in other parts of the city, I'd love to meet more people within the immediate area.  I imagine there are many other Astorians out there who feel the same way.  As they say... 'Why Leave Astoria?'  ;-)

Most outings will occur within the confines of Astoria, and they will be 'eclectic'. (Only occasionally will I suggest an event outside of Astoria...)  Another feature of this group is that events will be limited to 10 or so people at a time. I want people to truly get to know each other...to have good conversation...I don't want this to feel like a networking/pickup-y/name-tag kind of group. 

Our group (whose  events will be purposefully small in size) is not like other Meetup groups where you can feel anonymous.  Not showing up for events of this size does affect the host and other attendees.  I understand that things happen.  All I ask is that if you can no longer attend, or have a strong sense you will be held up at work or with family issues, that you give me Two Hours notice.  Anyone who simply does not show up or give me sufficient notice that they can no longer make the event (or else who doesn't provide a damn good explanation and profuse apology after the fact ....lol), will have to be removed from the group..  I don't do this to be a taskmaster or anything...it's just very disheartening for me to pay Meetup Organizer dues,  arrange events, provide very detailed information on events to the group, and then for me to arrive at the venue, only to find a bunch of no-shows.  All I ask is for common courtesy.  If you're not prepared to give me that, that you shouldn't join this group.  ;-)  Thank you for your understanding!

Every so often I will arrange for a somewhat larger outing, once I feel that enough good relationships have been created between members of the group.

'YES' to:

- members that are engaging, who have a positive energy, with varied interests, and who are comfortable meeting new people and diving right into conversation!

- members who understand our events will generally be small and intimate, and that communicating to the host if you can no longer attend, is expected.   

- events where we support and enjoy both the new AND the old-school establishments of Astoria. (I think it's hugely important to support the small businesses that have been in Astoria for more than a few years, and which seem to be gradually disappearing due to rent increases, etc,)

'NO to:

- joining this group with the sole purpose of hoping to fill that romantic void in your life.  (I prefer members who already consider their lives full and engaging versus people who come to events, scope out the attendees, decide there's no one that 'interests' them, and then they disengage from the group.)  There are plenty of other 'singles' Meetup groups if that's your area of focus.

- joining this group because you see all Meetup members as potential clients for your business, product, etc.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

I find groups most interesting when they have a good mix of members (singles/couples, straight/gay, younger/older, etc.,) so no one should think this group might not be for them!  I'd like to have members who've already figured out that you can be good friends with people who have different backgrounds from you, different political views, economic backgrounds, much older/younger than you, etc.  What matters most is that we all are people with positive energy, and respect each others' viewpoints.  

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

NOTE:  To help offset the fees that I must pay to Meetup.com each month as a Group Organizer, I'd like to kindly ask for a $3 donation from each member, whenever they attend one of our events.  Thank you!

Thanks for your interest, and hope to see you soon!
results.name: Eclectic Astorians

results.description:
Africa is in the midst of a long boom and on fast-track to becoming the next economic frontier. Techies of the African Diaspora is a group formed to build a platform that connects savvy IT professionals to engage in meaningful discussions, create partnerships, network, and exchange innovative ideas. 

Our objective is to provide a co-learning environment where specific IT related questions can be asked and proper responses are presented. We aim to guide and mentor aspiring ICT professionals. Furthermore, we intend to: 

- foster collaboration between ICT professionals living on the African continent and those in the diaspora

 - organize Tech Meet-Ups

- have hackathons and code retreats 

- attract underrepresented groups (minority and/or women in low-income communities)

-  advocate for public and private sectors in devising impactful ICT investment plans

The group is open to anyone interested in sharing knowledge and learning more about technology and how it impacts the African Diaspora.

results.description:
Join me in conversation, as I put the finishing touches on my book, “The Structure of Existence”; we will meet once each month (have 1 drink), and discuss:

1. Why do we exist?
2. What is existence?
3. What is the purpose of existence?

*When we all finish our drinks, the event is done!

I’m a 34 year old man with 10 fingers, who is knowledgeable, and I have the ability to type. I will share some of my ideas, read my essays, as well as encourage you to do the same. I will explain to you how I began writing philosophy by making arguments about “principles of photography”, and how I discovered that people are like black holes; you can only know that they exist by the effect that they have on the things around them. Our existence is paradoxical, because we need to consume to exist, but consumption eventually annihilates existence.
results.name: The Structure of Existence

results.description: Join me as I work toward building a world that lessens suffering for all, and not simply use the world to lessen my own suffering. It is through applying oneself, that one becomes, and it is in the struggle to have ones existence confirmed, and validated that we discover love; the only thing that gives life meaning, beyond which, life is absurd. Members of “Team Good Guys”, should want for others, what they want for themselves; to be able to think critically, to be empowered with knowledge, and to have opportunities to apply that knowledge; without both, the other is useless; and lastly, “Team Good Guys”, wants to be surrounded by others who encourage, and support them to live in the “Spirit of Goodness”. The world was built in the “Spirit of Goodness”, and anything that is the antithesis of “goodness” annihilates existence. “Goodness” leads us toward love; the confirmation, and validation of existence. Members of “Team Good Guys” are empowered persons; they don’t sacrifice others to themselves, or sacrifice themselves to others. As such, they do not allow others to sacrifice them. In life, we cannot ask for respect, and we cannot demand it; we must command it! Being a member of “Team Good Guys” means that you have to cultivate, and maintain yourself in “The Spirit of Goodness”.
results.name: Team Good Guys

We are people driven motivators. Our passion is to empower individuals in personal or corporate environments. Our desired results are to bring a strong presence of self-enlightenment and practical application to the world. 

About This Meetup:

results.description:
Women’s Master Mind Group was designed for successful businesswomen looking to surround themselves with like-minded women. It’s a group specifically designed for women who are looking to network with other successful professionals in order to grow their business.

The Power of Successful Women Working Together Results in More Powerful Women Working   

Women’s Master Mind Group invites you to join us twice a month to discuss your strategies and success in business. We will discuss what to do, and more importantly, what not to do. Inside tips and information will be an invaluable resource for everyone to walk away with at each meeting.

It will be a “meet and greet and listen and learn” experience for all. With expert advice from your peers, these meetings can help you take your business to the next level. Whether you are an aspiring entrepreneur, long-time business owner, or looking to diversify your business, you will become empowered with the knowledge you need by attending our monthly meetings and out bi-monthly networking sessions.

Our group is open to women who earn $100,000 or more a year, and for those looking to gain knowledge on acquiring new clients or customers through networking with similar-thinking people. Our first meeting will be a huge networking event. We plan to offer a networking event every other month after that. We encourage you to bring a friend or friend’s to help build a positive circle of sisterhood consisting of other professional business women.

Women’s Master Mind Group is the first of its kind! We are looking for true professionals who can put their differences aside and participate in genuinely helping each other to succeed. There are no egos in this group, so please check them at the door as you enter! Looks, race, social background, or educational background are never the agenda. Working together to market, network, and grow your business is what our group is all about!

Are You Ready To Become Even More Successful?

After attending each meeting, you are guaranteed to walk away with knowledge that you need to help you succeed. It may be cliché, but the power of positive thinking will always help you to attain your goals, no matter how lofty they may seem. Learn to be positive and to see yourself in an even more successful environment. Once you set your mind to achieve your goals, nothing will be impossible. Women working together in a synergistic environment can only produce positive results! Are you ready!
results.name: Women Master Mind Group

results.description:
Foods + Friends = The Good Life

Families and friends have been sitting down to enjoy meals together for decades. However, this tradition is quickly fading in today’s society. Social media, busy schedule and work life, quick and efficient fast food and take-out dinners in front of the television all lack the face-to-face interactions that are therapeutic. Research has shown that sitting down at the table with friends for a meal is enjoyable, fun, and may even improve our health! Bonds are reaffirmed, stress is relieved, level of happiness increased and depression alleviated.

One of the most wonderful things about New York City is its melting pot of ethnicities and its incredible ethnic diversity identity. Exploring different ethnic neighborhoods and sampling their delicious ethnic foods is a must, whether you live in NYC or are just visiting. Eating in an ethnic restaurant is about more than just the food, it’s a cultural experience that gives you a literal taste of life in another land.

If you enjoy dining on good food, meet new people, discover new restaurants and cuisines, come join us and together we will eat our way through a cornucopia of exotic cuisines representing all corners of the globe. Do all of this in a fun, relaxed setting with other adventurous eaters just like yourself!

MEETUP FEE:  To help defray the cost of paying Meetup HQ to keep the site up and running, a $1.00 Meetup fee will be collected at randomly selected events.

IMPORTANT GROUP RULES: A successful group is not about how many members there are in the group. It is about the quality of members in the group! We would rather have a small group of "quality members" than a huge group of "joiners" and “lurkers” who never show up to any event.

With that said:

(1) To join the group, you must have a recognizable face picture; and

(2) Being a member in the group, you don’t have to attend every event on the calendar, but try to participate in at least 1 event every few months. If you are a general lurker who join the group but not participate in any event, please don’t bother to join.

General rsvp policy:

Yes rsvps ONLY if you are serious about attending an event. No need to rsvp if not attending.

We will enforce a strict ANTI-FLAKE POLICY - Just one (1) no-show or last minute (less than 24 hours) cancel will get you booted out of the group.

If you are an RSVP-aholic, that is, you rsvp to every single event and then bail out last minute, you don't belong in this group and are NOT welcome.

results.description:
Women encouraging and helping other women to get strong and lift heavy -- it's that simple.

Ever looked at a barbell and wanted to use it, but got too nervous? Didn't know proper form? Wasn't sure if it was for you? Didn't want to "get too big?" Felt uncomfortable trying without a spotter?

I was there. With some exercises, I am *still* there, but the greatest resource we sister lifters, new and old, have out there are each other. I figure the best people to learn from, and the best folk to encourage to start are women in NYC who are willing to learn and to give back to new ladies who want to learn the ropes of heavy compound lifting (squats, deadlifts, bench presses, power lifting moves -- i.e. clean and jerk, etc).

Not limited to just barbell work, I'd like this to be a space where women can find spotters, create work out groups, attend boot camps, offer to be at a gym for a certain period of time so that others looking to start can reach out and have a contact that first day they step into a gym. Welcome sisters! Let's help each other build ourselves up.

results.description: KRAV MAGA is a Self Defense system developed for the military in Israel that consist of a wide combination of practical techniques and realistic training scenarios. Ideas in Krav Maga include: Counterattacking as soon as possible (or attacking pre-emptively). Targeting attacks to the body's most vulnerable points. Maximum effectiveness and efficiency in order to neutralize the opponent as quickly as possible. Maintaining awareness of surroundings while dealing with the threat. Learning to understand the psychology of a street confrontation, and identifying potential threats before an attack occurs This meetup group is for anyone who would like to learn Krav Maga. We can get together to learn Self Defense against any real world dangers and counter in the quickest and most efficient way. The intensity of these workouts will keep you physically fit, develop awareness and build confidence over time. I have asked a friend, David Ordini to show us some of the basics of Krav Maga. We can meetup once a week and learn self defense from a 9 year Krav Maga student who studied under the grand master. So come and join us at our next meetup, learn self defense, meet some new people and have fun.

results.description:
Ever since its release last spring, the NativeScript runtime has generated a great deal of buzz throughout the development community, and for good reason. In honor of its inception, this summer has been deemed the Summer of NativeScript! With the release of NativeScript, web engineers can translate their skills into the mobile frontier, so don't miss out on your chance to get hands-on experience with this powerful runtime! 

Telerik's Summer of NativeScript campaign has been sweeping the globe throughout the past few months. During July, attendees learned about the basics of the NativeScript Runtime - Those attending a Summer of NativeScript meet-up in August will be going beyond the basics of the runtime. Those who will be attending Summer of NativeScript in September will get the most detailed, and complex look at the runtime as the Telerik team has spent the summer curating videos, powerpoints, and detailed labs which can be custom tailored to your applications needs. That said, Telerik gives us the opportunity to hold three different meet-ups, where you will gain an extremely high-level perspective of the NativeScript runtime; however, if demand for this meet-up is low, we will be forced to condense it into one meet-up, which will be a deep-dive on NativeScript.


The time and place of NYC's Summer of NativeScript meet-ups will be announced in the upcoming weeks, so be sure to join to stay updated on any new information! 


Below, I have attached the material used thus far for Summer of NativeScript meet-ups. This material has been provided by Telerik. 


Meetup #1: Welcome to NativeScript

The first meetup is all about introducing NativeScript. The slides explain what NativeScript is and how to build apps with it. The hands-on lab walks you through the basics of starting an app and making changes to it.

Slides

• PowerPoint

• PDF

Video

• YouTube

Lab

• Instructions


Meetup #2: Beyond the Basics

The second meetup is about going about the basics with NativeScript. The slides explain concepts like navigation, data binding, CSS, and more—then the hands-on lab walk you through adding these features to a real app.

Slides

• PowerPoint

• PDF

Video

• YouTube

Lab

• Instructions


Meetup #3: Diving Deep

Slides

• PowerPoint

• PDF

Lab

•Instructions
