results.description:
This is a group for those who like Blues, Country & Gospel Music. "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!" are a unique entity in the NY/NJ music scene. They consider themselves the only guitar/vocal duo that mixes equal parts Rockabilly, Country and genuine guitar Gospel music with a spoonful of greasy Blues to wash it all down. Their influences include many seminal figures in American music, such as Hank Williams, Elvis Presley, Chuck Berry, Gene Vincent, Reverend Charlie Jackson, Howlin' Wolf, Wilbert Harrison, Arthur “Big Boy” Crudup, Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Brother Joe May, Charlie Feathers, Carl Perkins, Smiley Lewis, Brother Claude Ely and Lloyd Price, among many others. Watch them bring this amazing music alive at many great New York and New Jersey clubs and venues, and meet other like-minded fans of American Roots Music. This is not your father’s blues – it’s more like your grandfather’s…if your grandfather was a preacher in a Mississippi Baptist church.

What others are saying about "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!":

"When you hit the stage, it was like we were hit with a bolt of lightning! Truly electrifying! Really brought the place to life! You guys owned the stage like few have at The Way Station." - James Coyle

"These guys are amazing. The closest thing to Hank Williams Sr. this side of Heaven." - Jim Chum

"Together Gary Van Miert and Malcolm Marsden form the Sensational Country Blues Wonders, one of the best throwback blues groups on any side of the Hudson -- and quite likely good enough to swell with the Mississippi." - The Jersey Journal

"These guys are the real musical anarchists." - David Huberman

“They call it Country/Blues/Gospel, I call it.... I don't even know. If the lovechild of Carl Perkins and Hank Williams became a preacher whose church had a liquor store and an opium den, you might come close to The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” - Valdaniel Martins

We got there and the country group “The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” started their set. To be completely honest, country has never really been my favorite genre, but these guys TOTALLY changed my mind on country music. I absolutely loved them!! - CHICpeaJC
results.name: "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!"  Meetup Group

results.description: Lets go back in time for a bit. Back to the time when records and cassette tapes were in play, a time when simple things were fun. Remember when you used to run street light to street light? Or race your friends for fun? Oh, and field day at school. That was the best! The best times of your life. You were running fast — and it was fun. You were in the best shape of your life and didn't even realize it. Now flash forward. Those simple games filled with sprinting and fast movements have been replaced with idleness, jogging and other slow-twitch movements. It's time to change that. In fact, the only people who should perform low-intensity cardiovascular exercise like jogging are those who need to lose muscle tissue. To maximize your body composition and performance, sprinting is the modality of choice. A well-designed sprint program — that's where we come in — will significantly reduce body fat, increase work capacity and reaction time and develop your posterior chain (the fancy term for glutes and all the other muscles on the back of your leg) like that of a world-class athlete. Sprinting (yes, even now with more candles on your birthday cake) is the best thing you're not doing. A Tribe Called Sprinters is a fitness movement committed to making sprinting accessible to everyone for overall fitness and for competition.

Many doctors, educators and parents express growing concern at the increasing number of young people being put on powerful medication for Attention Deficit Disorder, a condition often identified only by vague symptoms. A disproportionate number of young people are labeled and treated for A.D.D. in the U.S. compared to most other countries. This fact alarms many authorities, including law enforcement officials who now report high levels of abuse of A.D.D. and A.D.H.D.-related, prescribed drugs. results.description: I recently lost my mother very suddenly, and have been surprised at how even NYC doesn't offer a support group for young adults who have lost a parent. While there are plenty of groups for kids and teens, older adults and even parentless parents, the "young adult" age range has been highly overlooked by bereavement support groups. Meanwhile, I have found it hard to relate to both people who lost parents in their teens or middle age; on the one hand, I had an adult relationship with my mother, but I also feel she will never get to see me finish "growing up" completely. On top of that, young adults are often living the most transitional, independent portions of their lives. Most of us here in NYC live away from family and our oldest friends, we are building careers, still figuring out who we are, experiencing the dizzying ups and downs of dating, and living in impermanent homes either alone or with strangers. My goal is to create a group who knows what it's like to be amidst the chaotic flows of young adult life while grieving the loss of a parent. This group is not so much based on age as it is what stage of life you feel you are in. If the above resonates with you, you are more than welcome to join. It does not matter how you lost your parent, or even if you are simply coping with a sick parent whom is still alive. Meetings will be casual, simple, fun, and relaxing -- a picnic at the park, a cool little restaurant, a warm bar, etc., and I strongly encourage all members to make suggestions. I just want to meet some new friends who are also figuring out how to live a good life under the heavy weight of grief, to hang out and heal in good company.
results.name: Young Adults Who Have Lost a Parent

results.description:
This is a social network for professional lesbians in the tri-state age range is 35 plus. Many know me as running the professional women's party Qgirls for many years.   I had an 'aha' moment of sorts as I wondered to myself as a newly single 40 something woman in the city why is it that I don't feel a sense of community.

We need to interconnect with one another and create our unity.  This group is not political nor is it a business.   This is about pure and simple connecting.  Speaking for me in my life most of my friends are coupled off and nesting.  I wished there was a safe place where folks could go on and post a fun idea or happening that they just didn't want to participate in by themselves.

I decided to take matters into my own hand and try to change the design of our scenery a bit.  I am hoping there are other women who feel the way I do. There are a lot of fun events to plan and things to do that would be so much more fun and rewarding doing with others.  I'm eager to meet and get to know other gay women on a deeper level than just saying hello when entering a party. 

We all know the old adage....lovers come and go but friends last forever.  Well I want it to be we can or don't have lovers but how full will our lives be with a REAL, GENUINE, DEPENDABLE social circle available to us.

Come join me in this journey and let's make Qgirls connections the destination for all professional women who are in search of friendship and support. 

I look forward to meeting you.

Cheers, Heather
results.name: Qgirl Connections - Social Network of Professional Lesbians

results.description:
Meet Up's Purpose: 

***Meet ups and events will take place throughout New York rotating primarily between Nassau County, Brooklyn, and Manhattan.***

Taking our inspiration from bell hooks and her book "Sisters Of The Yam: Black Women And Self-Recovery", we come together to celebrate each other and ourselves. We come together with the understanding that having a community of like-minded sisters can foster self-recovery, self-actualization, and continued healing. 

Members should expect to have fun, share, learn, and explore. We are building a community for support, healing, continued survival, and necessary change. Get ready for support, growth, and more. We will enjoy nights out, picnics, museum trips, cultural performances, dance classes, yoga sessions, meditation workshops, a book club, volunteering opportunities, and more exciting and healing adventures. 

“I mostly want to remind her of the recipes of healing, and give her my own made-on-the spot remedy for the easing of her pain. I tell her, “Get a pen. Stop crying so you can write this down and start working on it tonight.” My remedy is long. But the last item on the list says: “When you wake up and find yourself living someplace where there is nobody you love and trust, no community, it is time to leave town – to pack up and go (you can even go tonight). And where you need to go is any place where there are arms that can hold you, that will not let you go.” 
― Bell Hooks, Sisters of the Yam: Black Women and Self-Recovery


Who Should Join:

Like-minded Women Of Color

Why You Should Join:

Sisters Of The Yam is a space in which we can learn to take care of ourselves and each other. 

June Jordan in “Where is the love?” 1978

“I am a feminist, and what that means to me is much the same as the meaning of the fact that I am Black: it means that I must undertake to love myself and to respect myself as though my very life depends upon self-love and self-respect. It means that I must everlastingly seek to cleanse myself of the hatred and the contempt that surrounds and permeates my identity, as a woman, and as a Black human being, in this particular world of ours.”

Shanesha Brooks-Tatum in “Subversive Self-Care: Centering Black Women’s Wellness,” 2012

“Black women’s self-care is also subversive because to take care of ourselves means that we disrupt societal and political paradigms that say that Black women are disposable, unvalued. Indeed, people and things that aren’t cared for are considered expendable. So when we don’t take care of ourselves, we are affirming the social order that says black women are disposable.”
results.name: Sisters Of The Yam - NY

Each meeting will include a guided meditation and a stimulating discussion based on simple but powerful strategies and techniques that can be easily incorporated into daily life to create the success we want.

results.description:
Welcome to NYC Beach Bums! 

Our meetup group is dedicated to get all the beach loving people of NYC to our events at Rockaway Beach and other NYC beaches this summer and start of fall. 

If you love to just chill on the beach with your friends, or if your a novice or an experienced boarder looking for a cool way to meet new people and have a great time then this club is for you.  

We offer a summer, & fall season club membership which includes regularly scheduled events to Rockaway Beach, and when the swells arrive we'll be posting events at Gilgo Beach and Ditch Plains! Later in the fall we'll be announcing some overnight trips to camp out and go surfing in Montauk right on the beach! 

The club has it's own 14 passenger van for transporting our members to our events and is outfitted with a custom roof rack to carry any type of gear to our events so bring your boards, coolers, couches, koozies... and whatever else you need!

We have a love for the Rockaway's and have been surfing there for over 20 years. It would be our pleasure to be your Rockaway sherpa and put you on to all the cool destination beaches there and the local hot spots to grab some of the best food, adult beverages, and parties in NYC right by the beach. 

Once the surf season is over we also run a meetup called NYC Go Wild Outdoor Club which runs from October - April and will be hosting trips up to some of the coolest parts of the Catskills and go to hidden swim holes, hiking, tubing, kayaking, camping, fishing, and throwing down some kick ass bbq's in the middle of nature. 

This is a real deal club and we're looking for a solid crew of members to have an awesome time with!

Looking forward to meeting you all!

Mahalo from your friends at NYC Beach Bums

Call us with any questions you may have 1.347.931.1600
results.name: NYC Beach Bums

results.description: This ballroom dance meetup group will especially target those wallflowers who are self conscious due to feeling like they have two left feet. This goes for both men and women.  Men, if you are hesitant to put yourself out there, rest assured that, if you know how to dance, women will melt in your arms.  Even if your greatest fear is to simply put yourself out there to be seen by others when taking ballroom dancing lessons, rest assured that you will find comrades who are in the exact same position that your are, and who will not judge you based on your skill level. And by golly gee, you will be astounded by the alleviation of stress that this dynamic yet relaxed atmosphere will provide. In addition, if you fear the intimidation that some teachers can very well evoke, rest assured that Don is quite encouraging by focusing on what you have done right, as opposed to criticizing you for what you have done wrong. Thus, you will learn to dance with confidence. Not only will you look great, but you'll feel comfortable on the dance floor.

results.description:
A few weeks ago I decided to move and for the first time live with a roommate. I thought to myself, maybe I should try Craigslist. The moment I started to comb through Craigslist for a roommate I got overwhelmed and simply gave up. I couldn't tell who was authentic or who was a bot. The first emails I sent left me bombarded with spam. 

I tried two other sites that I will not mention here because it is not important but they could not deliver what I was expecting. Plus, the ritual of going back and forth instead of simply meeting and deciding within a short time and move on with my live was taking too much time. The frustration got to me and if you are here I believe you share this frustration. I have good news for you however. We can take the reins and take back control. Who says we need a third party to find you a roommate. 

This meetup will serve to find to find, professionals like yourself,  a roommate that meets your expectations. The success of this meetup will be in direct correlation to your commitment in showing up and participating. Basically, do not waste my time as I will not waster yours. 

The format of the meetup will be the same each week and will be as follows: 

1. Pre-populated Questionnaire – You will only have to do this once and given that your criteria for a roommate does not change you won’t have to do this ever again 

2. First 10 minutes - Chat or mingle or whatever you New Yorkers want to call it. 

3. Then 20 minutes of "algorithmically" matching you up with a roommate. Basically, I will use the information from the questionnaire to match you up with a few people and you get to decide if you want to talk with this person or not. 

4. Then another 25 minutes of you walking over and talking to someone that you think might be a great roommate. 

5. 5 minutes wrap up. You get to hear the success stories of people who found their roommate for that session.
results.name: Roommate Matchup for Professionals - New York City

results.description: This is Daniel Jordano, actor and author of the humbly titled: "The Best Book on Acting: How to Become a Better Actor Instantly Without Killing Yourself with the Method" If you are an actor, you've probably done your fair share of pointless exercises in classes: "Hold the imaginary teacup. Feel the warmth of the tea. Can you smell it? Can you smell it?" ...or you may have had your fill of "gurus" who may direct scenes, but don't give actors any understanding of how to get where they need to get--on their own! Well we are launching a NEW workshop on Sept. 24th called “The Life Acting Workshop” where we don't have any gurus. We focus on each member putting up work in an atmosphere of helping one another using a simple and effective system called …LIFE ACTING...with an emphasis on ON CAMERA work. Life Acting is summed up in the question: “What does your character want from the other actors/characters and how are you going to get it? At the current time, we are limited to 10 committed actors. The experience level is not the key issue here, but the willingness to make a commitment to the work. Each workshop is only $25. The initial one will take place from 7pm to 10pm on Thursday, September 24th My goal for this is to develop an encouraging and safe place to work and improve our craft as actors. I am serving as the facilitator. Not a guru. We will learn and be encouraged by ONE ANOTHER!
results.name: The Life Acting Workshop

results.description:
Write, Speak, and Teach is a meetup to create momentum for its members to create and ship great content.

If you are a writer, speaker, or teacher (or an author, podcaster, coach, or trainer) you need to get the word out about your work. Content marketing is the best way to get the word out and build your platform.

Content marketing means creating great content, in multiple formats, and then engaging with others about the content, in ways that creates more content, which builds your brand and visibility. 

In the process of creating content, your best effort and a deadline should be the goal, not perfection. 

Lets come together as a group in fun interactive ways, to learn, to take on the challenge of disciplined content creation, and to create momentum for ourselves and each other. 

This group requests member dues because we meet in NYC at a cool interactive space, which costs decent money.

Our first meetup will be a "Launch Some Work" challenge to get the ball rolling.

"Create and ship... create and ship..."

results.description: We are a social group for LGBTQ Single Parents. Whether you are a parent through biology, adoption, Donor Egg/Sperm, Surrogacy or Fostering, let's connect! Maybe you have been out since you were 12. Maybe you are just coming out. Either way, you are all included. Maybe you are just thinking of becoming a single LGBT parent, or perhaps you are already in the midst of trying and need encouragement and advice. All are welcome. results.description: I started a book club almost 2 years ago (October, 2013) with a small group of friends/family either living or working in NYC via an email distro and we're still going strong almost 2 years later. This book club meets once a month (we aim for the 2nd tuesday of each month, but it does change from time to time based on the availability of the sub-group of people interested in attending each month. This book club is super chill - come whenever you can come type of thing. We tend to meet at restaurants/cafes or at someone's apartment if they are able to host. There is no theme in terms of types of books we choose for the book club - I choose books for the the first half of the year and second half of the year ahead of time so that you know which books are in the pipeline/can decide which book to reach for the corresponding month. results.description:
Welcome to the Bronx Ultimate Frisbee Meetup!

This group is for people who enjoy to have a fun competitive ultimate Frisbee experience. Many times your own friends may not be as interested in this sport the same way you are, and if that's the case, this meetup is for you! Ladies, Gentlemen, New players, and seasoned players who are willing to give it their best on the field are welcome! Although I myself like to play competitively, I ask that all knowledgeable players be open to playing with new players to help promote this amazing sport and to widen the number of people who participate. Our meetups will be held on Tuesdays, Thursdays and some Saturday's between the hours of 6-9pm in Bronx Park East (across the street from the Mobile gas station in the outfield of the baseball field or by the light posts), but that is subject to change depending on the groups availability. As we know, the summer season will be ending but I will do my best to keep my games going (and if not make a different type of meetup for the winter months) within the Bronx or upper Manhattan for all my Bronx people. I have traveled to Ultimate Frisbee meetups in the city and dealing with the travel time (1-2 hrs), rush hour (sardines on a train OR traffic), and no shows (not even a single "hey games cancelled today"), was a bit too frustrating for me. For this reason I decided to make a meetup where people from the Bronx do not have to leave their borough, and so that people who live a bit more downtown do not have to deal with to much traffic and be able to enjoy a perfectly good frisbee game with like minded individuals. With that being noted, I will surely send notifications if ever I will not be attending an event or in the case of any unfortunate event. I will also bring my own 175g Frisbee, cones, rules (which are subject to change) to all events but you are more than welcome to bring your own as well. If you are new to the rules of ultimate Frisbee here is a website so that you can brush up on them (I know I need to do so as well): http://www.usaultimate.org/resources/officiating/rules/default.aspx#10simplerules IMPORTANT NOTE: Please RSVP if you will be attending, and notify if you will not be able to make it if you have already RSVP. This helps to avoid any waste of my time and your fellow members time. Currently, I have played in Bronx Park East, but I am in the process of waiting on a permit from NYC Parks so that I can use the field without any problems in the future.

If you have any questions, comments or concerns please feel free to message me at anytime. Thank you.
results.name: Bronx Ultimate Frisbee Meetup

results.description:
Welcome and thank you for your interest. New York Upscale Singles Meetup is for Singles over 45 who enjoy fine dining as well as sports, theater, movies, wine-tastings, dancing and other fun social activities. We meet roughly once or twice a month (usually Saturday evening) at some of the best restaurants in New York City. <br>

PLEASE NOTE THIS IS NOT A DATING CLUB! WE ARE A SINGLES OVER 45 FRIENDS CLUB! <br>

It is ALSO important to note that most restaurants and other experiences offered in this group will be in the $100 per person AND MORE range, so, if this isn't your budget range then we probably won't be a good fit for you. There is no fee to join, but, there is a $1 non refundable holding fee for ALL restaurant events. This is done for two reasons: to make sure you actually wish to attend and aren't just RSVPing without reading about the event and what to expect and second it helps weed out non-participating members. So many Meetup groups have tons of members and only a small percentage that actually participate. This method helps reduce non participating members - we do a sweep of members every 3 months. If you are inactive for 3 months you will receive a warning notice. If you are inactive after 6 months you will be removed from the group. (That's fair, right?) <br>

If we attending the theater or a movie or other activity that requires prepayment. Full details will be disclosed on the event page from how to pay to how to collect your ticket. <br>

Activities Include: <br>

• Dining Out <br>

• Sporting Events<br>

• Dancing <br>

• Movies <br>

• Theater <br>

• Opera <br>

• Museums <br>

• Wine Tastings and Classes <br>

• Summer picnics <br>

• Cooking Classes

<br>
results.name: New York Upscale Singles over 45

results.description: Spreading the art of Kathak with our pholisophy - " Art is a bridge to the values of life ". To impart training mainly in the field of Indian Classical Dance Kathak and other associated Indian Classical Performing Arts / Disciplines like vocal, music, harmonium, sitar, percussion and other classical and folk dance forms, yoga, etc. To inculcate Indian values of life amongst the masses, more particularly the younger generation through the Guru-Shishya Parampara – leading to a direct interaction of the teacher and the student, making the relation special and personal. The purpose of training is not only to produce talented artists but also to pass on the true Indian culture and values amongst the students as well as their family members and the society at large. To cultivate and enhance the interest in dance and other performing arts highlighting that they are not only the medium of entertainment but also a medium for proper channelization of emotions as this plays a vital role in determining the quality of life. Balanced growth of physique, mind and spirit/soul/emotions helps in developing fundamental moral values. Learning an art form also makes one more receptive, sensitive and helps in the development of one’s aesthetic nature. This outlook helps a person to work not only for oneself but also for society at large and thus the masses are benefited. To organize workshops, lecture-demonstrations and Meets with prominent artists & Gurus, with an aim to nurture and further develop the participants interest and give the participants a platform to interact with the senior artists and Gurus and learn from them directly. To produce or arrange for productions and choreographies for presentation in various festivals, programmes and communication media. To work for development and advancement of dance, music and other performing arts and to set up and maintain Educational Institute and Research Center in these fields.

results.description:
Welcome to Go Wild NYC! 

Our meetup group is dedicated to all the outdoor adventure loving people of NYC to experience a kick ass lineup of events in the state parks and private campgrounds surrounding the Hudson Valley and the Catskills. 

From October - April we'll be hosting a regular schedule of day trips, and multi day trips to some of the most beautiful New York State Parks and natural wonders to explore the outdoors and all it has to offer. 

In the winter season we'll be hosting as many trips as possible up to the mountains as well for our NYC Snow Bums to hit the slopes upstate and in Vermont. 


Our Trips Include

Waterfall & Nature Hikes
Swimming Holes
Delaware River Tubing
Camping January - April
Snowboarding
Skiing

Whether you want to just kick back in one of the beautiful state parks with your friends to BBQ and party with the local wildlife, or if your a novice or an experienced skier or boarder looking for a quick staycay and a cool way to meet new people to have a great time then this club is for you. 


The club has it's own 14 passenger van for transporting our members to our events and is outfitted with a custom roof rack to carry any type of gear to our events so bring your boards, coolers, couches, koozies... and whatever else you need!

We have a deeply rooted love for the Catskill's and Hudson Valley area's and have been exploring there for over 20 years. 

It would be our pleasure to be your sherpa. Once the fall and winter season are over we also run a membership club and meetup called NYC Beach Bums which runs from May - September and will be hosting regular trips up to some of the coolest beached in New York like the Rockaway's, Gilgo Beach, and Ditch Plains.

This is a real deal club and we're looking for a solid crew of members to have an awesome time with! Looking forward to meeting you all!

Love and Peace from your friends at Go Wild NYC!

results.description:
Folks in the vicinity of Spyten Duyvil, Riverdale, and Kingsbridge, sections of the Bronx, or Inwood section of Manhttan, or anybody who is willing to travel to these areas.

If your tired of being overweight, outta shape, and wishing to be thin again and need all motivation in the world, say to your self; "Let's do it ! , and be all in, totally committed no matter what the weather is , or how tired and unmotivated you are or how too early it may be.

Here's a little about me. All my life I was a skinny in shape person (134 lbs). Ten years ago injured my feet and could no longer run. I would lay on a couch from the minute I came home from work until I had to go back. Im now 49 years old, 209 lbs and round. I have my foot pain under control for about 2 years now, and desire to run again. I love exercising (PT) in groups like when I was in the Army. So here is what I want to do:

I figure after the summer is over and everybody goes back to work, I would like to start a morning exercise (PT) group, that would meet, Monday thru Saturday in the morning. We will start very slow, super duper slow, and over the course of time build ourselves up and lose weight at the same time.

We motivate each other and as we do it each day, and as time goes by it will become easier and feel less awkward. Like the lottery, you got to be in it to win it.

Here are a few ideas that I have as I live in Spyten Duyvil. We can either meet in Van Cortland Park, Inwood Park or at the base of the Henry Hudson Bridge and make our way over to Inwood park. Or we can do Palisades Ave for a very slow start and build up over time to a full throttle. Everyday begins and ends with a full stretch session.

I hope to here from you

results.description:
The Brooklyn HubSpot User Group (HUG) is a community of Inbound marketing professionals and business owners. Some of us have been using HubSpot for years, some of us run marketing agencies, and some are just starting to learn about Inbound. If you love networking and exploring new ways to grow your business, join us for a meetup!

Do I have to be a HubSpot User?

Nope! In addition to current users, we welcome anyone interested in learning more about HubSpot or Inbound Marketing in general. That said, our agenda will typically include a deep-dive into some aspect of the HubSpot tools, or a customer case study.

Is this Going to be a Sales Pitch?

No! The sole purpose of a HUG is to get together and learn the best of HubSpot from one another. A basic tenet of Inbound Marketing is understanding that people hate being sold to. We earn trust through education.

What's a Typical HUG Agenda Like?

All HubSpot user groups follow a similar agenda, which includes networking, an educational presentation, and a group discussion. At least twice each year we'll also have guest speakers from HubSpot headquarters join us! Our meetups are casual, helpful, and provide members with complimentary food, drinks and HubSpot SWAG.

What Should I Bring to the Meet-Up?

Business cards for networking, something to take notes (Wifi will be available, if you want to bring a laptop or tablet), and an open mind for learning and sharing.

Can My Company Host a Meet-Up?

Absolutely! One of the more challenging aspects of meetup planning is finding space, so if your company can accommodate a group of 30+, let's chat. We require a location our members can get to easily via major subway lines, high-speed Wifi, a large presentation monitor (or a large screen and laptop projector), enough space for networking, and the ability to bring in food and drinks. In exchange for your hospitality, we'll include your logo and link to your site on our registration landing page, as well as social media promotion. Email bklynhug@gmail.com to start a conversation!
results.name: Brooklyn HubSpot User Group

results.description:
Welcome to Beyond Borders! We're setting out to be the largest community of 1st generation trailblazers in the world. Join us! #diasporans #myparentsareimmigrants #forgeinborn #crossculturalcommunity #trailblazer 

1st generation - VERY loosely defined as those who've migrated from their home country or were born in their parents' host country. 

This group will transcend racial, cultural, and national boundaries to bring us together in the name of shared life experiences. On a daily basis we navigate multiple worlds, languages, families, and identities beyond borders. Here, you can count on effortless fun and authentic social gatherings that enable us to bond over our journeys, share resources, anchor one another, laugh, and build intergenerational/intercultural community around the world. Just imagine, because of the community you'll have in Beyond Borders, you can be any where in the world and always have a place to call home.

Whether your journey was long ago, recently, or today as you maneuvered between your and your immigrant parents' realities, cheers to the largest energetic social community of people with your shared experience! Share this group with loved ones and encourage entire families to join.

Event types:  group 'going home' trips, remittance parties, hackathons, slam storytelling, foreign accent stand-up comedy, fundraising, speaker series, potlucks, movie nights, date nights, travel workshops, adult camp, mentorship, holiday celebrations, and podcast series.

Let's take pride and ownership of this genuine community where the unspoken language of living beyond borders bonds us. 

 See you soon. #YouAreWelcomed
results.name: Beyond Borders - 1st Generation Trailblazers!

Each of us need supporters, mentors, and cheerleaders who encouragingly support our vision and goals .

We are seeking those who struggle with procrastination; who lack clarity of vision; or need that encouraging word of accountability that motivates us to keep on keepin on and Get It Done!

"You can have everything in life that you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want" -- Zig Ziglar

results.description:
This group is for people with love for the urban sport of handball.  Since I couldn't find a group on here for myself, I thought I'd start one up.  Although the group is open to all levels, I would like to keep the pace casual.  Let it be a group for people who just want to meet up and play; exercise, socialize, all that good stuff.  I just hit forty years old and it's difficult to find mature people to play with.  You would find that I have a deep personal attachment to the game.

  I call the group 'Wall Network' because there are walls located all over NYC and Meet Ups can happen anywhere.  I'm only organizer of this group because I started it; but my hope is that people will join, get talking, and post some friendly challenges.  You come to me; I come to  you.   I love exploring new parks and discovering their walls.  Maybe you have a cool one by you, or maybe we can all discover one together.  As it stands now, it's just me, so I guess I'll have to start by posting where i'll be and when.  Anyone's welcome to call 'Next!'

Human resource departments throughout the region are unable to fill hundreds of vacancies for highly qualified bilingual and technical professionals. Yet the fact that this shortage of staffing is occurring at the same time that thousands of experienced bilingual and technical candidates are unemployed, deserves attention.

To help address said employment challenges, the New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network Is creating this community of professionals with bilingual capabilities and/ or or tech experience/training.

The New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network will organize networking meetups to enable members to discover new career opportunities, and on occasion obtain useful professional development too! Members will benefit from face to face networking with peers, expanding local businesses, non-profits and government institutions to gain knowledge and insight into future employment as well career training opportunities. 

 The New York & New Jersey Bilingual and Tech Career Network welcomes your thoughts, suggestions, and recommendations as well as sponsorship inquires and wishes success to all!

People should join us to learn, share, grow , and have fun.  A typical activity would be attending a workshop, going out for a meal, going to a movie, journaling about an experience, making a DYI product, and more.   Let's get together and experience different activities that promote wellbeing and add value to our lives. We will have workshops and social activities that will enliven and inspire us. Looking for positive people to join the group who would like to experience activities to add balance to your life.

results.description: New York City isn't the easiest or friendliest place to fly RC airplanes. We don't have the luxury of wide open fields with no one around to bother. I am a member of a local aviation club, but it can take up an hour or longer each way to get there and it just isn't always practical. I like to fly small to larger airplanes as well. I've found that some respectful and cautious local flying in NYC can be possible if we really respect our surroundings and don't do stupid things. This meetup is only for RC Airplanes and unfortunately no Quadcopters or Drones. I own and enjoy some myself, but the reckless use of these had shed a negative light on the hobby and there are other groups for that. My aim is to gather some quiet, respectful and fun people to fly our planes as close to or in Manhattan without causing any issues and flying places which don't violate restrictions. I have a whole series of future events and plans that I am working on but this is a simple start.
results.name: New York Radio Control Airplanes Meetup

topics.name: Anything and everything you've ever wanted to do.
Trying New Things with Like Minded People!

results.description:
This is an experimental Meetup group for those of us who do things a bit more impromptu: we might wake up on a Saturday morning and decide to go rock climbing or hiking; or we thought we were going to have a mellow weekend but get a little restless. We text our friends but it's too last minute -- gosh darn those planners! This Meetup group is intended to bring us together and make those spontaneous adventures a little more social. 

We will organize monthly Meetups - happy hours, picnics, etc.: larger events where people in the group can get together and meet. For regular activities, we will use the Okk app (http://okk.co). It's better suited for bringing together small groups of people in a more impromptu fashion and allows groups to organize and chat without having to share your phone number or email. Post your activity using the #nycsp hashtag so members can more easily find them! 

Once we get our regular happy hours going, our hope is that we will be able to greatly extend each others’ social circles with more familiar faces and have a larger network to draw from when we decide to do something spur of the moment! Looking forward to meeting everyone!
results.name: New York City Spontaneous People (20s to 30s)

results.description:
Calling all novel nerds and literature ladies! Welcome to FICTION ADDICTION, an ensemble of young women (aged 20-35) who read, gather, and drink. Our fiction addiction is fed by a novel and a graphic novel each month. Meeting locations are chosen based on the theme of the book and proximity to multiple train stations. 

Each month we decide on a theme. Will it be murder, graphic novel memoirs, dystopian fiction, or fearless female leads? It's up to you to decide! Once chosen, the group is given 5 choices for that month's read. For those avid readers who need MORE to read, in between each monthly book club is a separate cultured comic club who reads a graphic novel. 

Perhaps the next Meetup will be held at a 1920s speakeasy, a Victorian parlor, a warm biergarten, or a back alley apothecary. It's up to you to decide! 

So pull a book off your shelf, crack that spine, pour yourself a glass of wine and start reading with us! 

"A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies." - George R.R. Martin
results.name: Fiction Addiction: Women Hooked on Books

results.description: Imagine adding thirty or more people to your sales force overnight, without adding a penny to your payroll. Imagine having a network of trusted professionals to whom you can refer your existing clients for all their needs from accounting to tailoring. Now imagine both of those things in one place and you have LeTip: an organization of professionals dedicated to mutual support and providing valuable word-of-mouth marketing for each other.

results.description:
The NYSA group meets for an extraordinary odyssey into a healing sound-scape for a deeper meditation, renewed inspiration and greater enlightenment fostering inner harmony and tuning in to the music of our own souls.

Hello, I AM Sunny Quetzacoatl. I AM native to the high desert of central Mexico, of Toltec ancestry, born in the land of the Chichimeca. I recently relocated to New York from Los Angeles, CA. and I look forward to contributing sound vibration therapy as a healing art modality. I offer to guide my fellow sound alchemists into a beautiful dream through which we will all reach a zero point state of being. My intention for NY Sound Alchemy is to create a comfortable, invigorating, magical, mysterious, and healing "sound-bath/sound-scape" for my guests. I will play several instruments to relax you and inspire you.

I seek to activate your 6 senses. I will offer organic vegan friendly cacao tea and oils to activate the senses accordingly. Very minor adjustments of shoulders before during or after to those who ask. Sage & Palo Santo may also be used.

My sonidos curanderos will help wash away all stress, worry and discomfort and the vibrations within our space will unlock your imagination. Together, through breath and sound, we will create a perfect sound-scape; a sonic, phonic arena for your spirit to travel to and through. I invite you to join me and my fellow NY Sonic Shamanic alchemists as we travel with the mind, body and spirit by being present w stillness and contributing a steady thorough breath.

Guy Douglas "The Gong Man", "DEEP Exhale"/LA and "Sonic Shamanic"/LIB-DoLab-SoCal. are my soundscape progenitors; and what I contribute is a nexus of deep rooted tribal vibrations and an oscillation of fluid, elastic, Cosmic pulsations. You will be raptured by the sounds of a Live Native American flute, Didgeridoo drone pipe, Ocean wave drum, Crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, rain monsoon tower, thunder-maker, serpent rattle, and a sometimes (as inspired) very special Sun language orison; a vernacular tongue which you may surprisingly recognize. Welcome to the New York Sound Alchemisty movement.
results.name: New York Sound Alchemy

I formed this group because I'm tired of creating only those things that yield a paycheck. I want to implement the money-sink ideas that I've imprisoned to the "someday" room in my mind. The first of these ideas is an autonomous underwater vehicle with the purpose of exploring the waters around Manhattan. If you're interested in working on this, you should definitely join. results.description:
It's not a typo! Wallyball is a fun and exciting sport that has recently become more popular in the NYC area and even though it derives from volleyball, it has its own rules: It is played on a racquetball court, in teams of 3, but the reason it is so enjoyable is that players are allowed to play the ball off of the side walls' bounce.

For all of you, volleyball junkies, this is a great way to challenge your game. 

For those of you who are fairly new to volleyball, you can be sure that you will have a great time while you're working your butts off!

You have two options to choose from:

 1. Join a team and participate in the only official Wallyball League in New York City. 

2. Join as an individual member and come to our open plays every Monday and Wednesday night. 


For details, visit: http://www.nyvolleyballinstitute.com/
results.name: New York City Wallyball

No longer is someone coming to hire you, to invest in your company, to sign you, to pick you. It’s on you to make the most important decision in your life: Choose Yourself.

Choose Yourself Community is a global network of 3,000+ entrepreneurs, visionaries and idea machines interested in living life on their own terms. results.description:
Join us on Saturdays in Church Square Park for a fun filled class to learn classic boxing techniques with cross training fitness emphasis.

Class Fee $10 per person  for the 1 hour Boxing Session

If you want to play you must bring the gear of the pro's:

• Boxing gloves

• Hand wraps/ Wrap gloves

• Workout clothes / sneakers

• Towel 

• Bottle of water

• Optional equipment Boxing mitts and jump rope ( if you have them bring them-the more the merrier)

Boxing SGT (small group training) class break down:

• 5 - 10min park / workout area run

• Jump rope / plyometric warmup (burpees,  jump squats, ladder drills etc..)

• Focus mitts work ( boxers punching mitts technique drills )

• Semi-contact ; you and your partner strike the pads using time tested boxing techniques (no this is not a cardio kickboxing dance class )

• 3 minutes rounds and 30 second active rest ( push-ups, squat jumps, running in place etc..)

• Partner drills (medicine ball , resistance bands , kettle-bells etc..)
results.name: Hoboken Boxing Class Meetup

results.description: If you are getting this note, it’s because you’re progressive and active and spectacular. It’s also because you have indicated an interest in Bernie Sanders’ candidacy for president. We need your energy and your voice in the upcoming months to help Bernie Sanders get elected the 45th President of the United States. We know that Bernie Sanders is the ONLY candidate that is going to improve the quality of life for people of color in this country. And it’s on us (black people) to share this message with our family, friends and communities. We need to organize and mobilize from now through November of 2016. We started African Americans for Bernie (#AAFB) to accomplish this very goal. We know there are a lot of black folks that are supportive of Bernie, but so far, we only exist online. We want to step from behind the screens for a moment and get together in person to meet one another and talk. There are a lot of events coming up, rallies, conferences, so we want to pull everything and everyone together and talk about we can all do together to help get Bernie Sanders elected. We are meeting on Monday, August 24th at 6:30 at Negril Village at 70 W 3rd St between Thompson St and Laguardia Place in Greenwich Village. *Everyone has different talents and gifts and we need all of them! But if you are a blogger or a active media person, we especially need you to come on Monday. FEEL THE BERN!!
results.name: African Americans for Bernie Sanders NYC Meetup

results.description:
The Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce Meetup Group provides business owners, entrepreneurs, and professional service providers a forum to share ideas, strategies, discuss problems, and explore opportunities that will help grow businesses and increase profits.

We meet monthly. Topics will include branding, social media, negotiating, presentation skills, marketing, workplace communication, financial controls, technology, cyber-security, hacking, and risk management. The Fort Lee business community is fortunate to have many experts in these fields. A meeting could include a guest presentation, a discussion panel or table set up for questions and answers with one of these people.

This Group is about the exchange of ideas with other liked-minded business professionals who want to advance their knowledge and awareness of what it takes to succeed in today's fast changing business environment. Looking to share your business experience? Looking to pick up some new ideas? That’s what we’re all about. 

This is not a networking group or a place to get leads. There is, however, an opportunity to make new connections.  This is not the place to make your sales pitch, although your sales method can be an interesting subject to discuss with other sales professionals. Sharing ideas openly with others on what works, and what doesn’t, can improve your game.

For over 65 years the Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce has been promoting and supporting our business community. This is an exciting time for Fort Lee as we experience a renaissance of new business and residential growth. This Group is not limited to members of the Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce. It’s open to all businesses and their employees.

We invite you to join us to share your ideas and experiences as well as your questions and concerns, and become part of Fort Lee’s exciting future.

 Thank you for your time,

 Respectfully,

 FORT LEE REGIONAL CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
results.name: Fort Lee Regional Chamber of Commerce Meetup Group

results.description: We are lovers of philosophy who have been heavily influenced by (without being constrained to) the writings of Hegel, Kierkegaard, Nietzsche, Husserl, Heidegger, Derrida, Freud, Lacan (as well as Adriaan Peperzak, Jean Hyppolite, Patrick McCarty, Thomas Sheehan and others). Our purpose is to read something every week (typically short) and meet to discuss it--and enjoy each other's company.  We tend to rely heavily upon the writings of Patrick McCarty and Adriaan Peperzak for their accessibility and succinctness (both superb scholars).  An average reading is probably 20 pages.  They are the focal point for the discussion, but not mandatory for attendance.  We welcome any and all interested persons!  We welcome the addition of co-hosts, too.
results.name: Philosophy Weekly Group

Onshape is the first and only full-cloud 3D CAD system that lets everyone on a design team simultaneously work together using a web browser, phone or tablet. You can access and edit your designs from anywhere, on any device, for free.

Onshape Users – New York is for anyone, whether you are already using Onshape for your design projects or just wanting to learn more about the future of CAD. This is a place to connect with other designers, share your ideas, and learn about current and upcoming Onshape functionality.

If you don't already have a free Onshape account, create one here and begin using CAD in minutes!

Health and Support, Happiness, Wellbeing, Healing
What is Happiness: What Makes Us Happy

results.description:
About Happiness Clubs

A Happiness Club is a monthly forum with the sole mission of promoting the benefits and scientifically-proven theories of Happiness and Positive Psychology.  Meetings feature inspirational speakers who will introduce us to different happiness boosting techniques and ways we can increase our emotional and physical wellbeing. 

Happiness is an inner state of well-being that empowers an individual to be their best possible self, and we could all use a little more!

Positive Psychology is the scientific study of human flourishing, and an applied approach to optimal functioning. It has been defined as the study of the strengths and virtues that enable individuals, communities and organizations to thrive.  So, let's explore this together!

There are approximately 140 Happiness Clubs worldwide, including a number of them in Connecticut with long-standing histories within their communities.

For more information: http://happinessclub.com

About the Facilitator

Donna Vella is a healthy lifestyle and positivity advocate.  She is a 2012 graduate of the Institute for Integrative Nutrition and is a Certified Holistic Health Coach. She is currently studying Positive Psychology under Dr. Tal Ben-Shahar and is pursuing a second career as a Happiness Ambassador and Positive Psychology Coach. Donna is a volunteer for The Orthopaedic Foundation for Active Lifestyles, Slow Food USA/Fairfield County, former Team Captain – WalkTheWalk America, and was known as “Dr. Ima CrackUp, the Tender Heart Specialist” in Stamford Hospital’s Health and Humor Associates (HAHA) Caregiving Clown Program.

For the last 25 years, Donna has kept corporate CEOs and senior executives organized.  She is currently the office manager for a Stamford, CT. based commodities trading firm.  Donna was born and raised in upstate New York and is a graduate of the Rochester Institute of Technology.  She lives in Stamford with her husband, Mike.
results.name: Stamford Positive Living Forum

results.description:
Purpose of the Group

The purpose of this group is to provide all levels of spiritual seekers a practical and effective means of manifesting to higher levels of consciousness. Those who truly seek greater truths and are Willing to surrender preconceived notions, beliefs, ideas, opinions, and views are guaranteed an advancement in their own awareness. Those who say they are willing but still cling to various instilled beliefs and illusory fears due to past experiences, are not guaranteed the same outcome.

• Willingness = readiness, plus personal conviction to affect a change through trust in a higher power greater than oneself. 

• Surrender = release, relinquish, or give up any beliefs, opinions, or ideas that one believes to be true about oneself, others, life and the world.


Intention of Meetings

The intention of each meeting is to provide spiritual principles that one may practice in life to attain higher levels of awareness/consciousness.­ The concordant practices and principles encompass a variety of teachings throughout human history that when adhered to can lead to the state known as enlightenment or bliss. In reality, all the teachings are essentially the same thing varying only in culture, location, time period, etc... Therefore, the agenda is to present the principles and facilitate an understanding of them and the means by which they can be used with the current life circumstances members would like to address.
results.name: Consciousness Transcended

results.description:
This all-girls group is aimed at professional career-oriented women aged 31-45 to meet for brunch, dinner, happy hours, movies, impromptu picnics in Manhattan and surrounding boroughs. I'm 38 so I decided to go up 7 years and down 7 years to ensure a good range of age for potential life-long friends. This group will encourage members to form new and lasting friendships with other like-minded career-oriented women in the similar age bracket of 31-45. 

With that said, I hope to have a meetup at least once a week for a total of 4-5 meetups each month (ranging from brunch, dinner, happy hour to dinner and a movie, Friday afternoon lunch, etc) for small intimate parties of 6-10. There is a $3 meetup fee that will be collected offline at the end of the meetup when the bill arrives. It will be used to offset the meetup organizational costs ($180 per year for running a group). Please bring enough cash to cover this. If you sign up for a meetup and fail to show up (2) times or cancel within 2 days of the meetup, you will be removed from this group and banned. No exceptions so only sign up if you are sure you can make the meetup.

A recognizable photo picture on your profile and answers to all my profile questions are required in order to be allowed into the group. I will cap group membership at 100-110 women, and keep active members only  in order to keep the group manageable. If you do not agree to the above rules and regulations, feel free not to join my group - there are thousands of other meetup groups so if my rules offput you, you are welcome to not join it and find another group more suited to your needs.

Hope to see you soon at a meetup!

results.description: If you own a Honda Civic, are you not a Honda Civic? Does the Honda Civic not indicate your wealth, which reflects your work, which reflects your mind? Although you may be a Honda Civic, you don't want to be reduced to a Honda Civic, but you cannot reduce a person with a Lamborghini to a Lamborghini, because that is a desirable status, but a Bugatti owner might be able to get away with it. No one is fighting for freedom, we are all simply resisting enslavement! You are a slave when you don't appreciate yourself, enjoy what you do, and value what you possess. If you want to be Grrreat!, then this group is for you. Ideal members are anyone, and everyone, as long as you are alive, because life is about a struggle toward greatness. results.description:
We believe that books have the ability to transform lives! 

Join us for lively discussions of books that inspire, motivate and help us live our best lives. We focus on self-help, personal development and spirituality books. 

Reading groups enhance the reading experience by creating a community of people who help you expand your consciousness. We started this group because we wanted to create a space where people who like to read soul-stirring books could come together to share our thoughts and experiences. It will also be a great place to meet new people and create new friendships. 

Some of the authors we’ll be reading who represent this genre are:

Joel Osteen ~ Wayne Dyer ~ Eckhart Tolle ~ Don Miguel Ruiz ~ Thich Nhat Hanh ~ Deepak Chopra ~ Pema Chodron ~ Gary Zukav ~ Ram Dass ~ Dalai Lama ~ Byron Katie ~ Marianne Williamson ~ Michael Bernard Beckwith ~ Harville Hendrix ~ and many others 

We meet in midtown Manhattan the 2nd Sunday of the month at 3 pm. 

Members are encouraged, but not required, to select and host a book at a monthly meeting. This responsibility will be rotated each month. As the discussion leader for the book you select, you're expected to provide 3-5 questions for the group to discuss. Discussion questions can be found at the end of the book , at the author's website , at the publisher's website , by Googling the title of the book , or by creating your own questions. Please check to see if the book you're hosting is available at the library for those who prefer to borrow rather than buy. The library websites are: nypl.org , bklynlibrary.org , queenslibrary.org 

Members are also expected to have read the book before the meeting so you can contribute to the discussion in a meaningful way. 

If you too believe that shared reading will enhance your reading experience, please consider joining us.
results.name: Live Your Best Life Book Club

results.description:
Meetup purpose

Sometimes we are not strong enough by ourselves to change our ways, or to kick bad habits. I started this group because I want people to be supporters of each other. Help each other change their ways, form new habits, and live a happier life. Support can then become like a life line that is used to keep yourself motivated. It's helpful to know you are not alone in what keeps you from changing your ways, and to hear other people's stories. Let's gather, let's talk about it, and most importantly let's Kick "it"(bad habits).


Who should join?

This is a group for all the people who are fed up with their bad habits, and finally want to kick them to the curve. Whether it's eating, exercising, communicating, thinking, speaking, smoking, or any bad habit , kick it! This includes those moments when you let people take advantage of you, or are very passive. If it's not making you a better person then it has to go.


Why should you join?

You should join if you like to join others in their fight to free themselves from the imprisonment of bad habits! You never know who you might help , or who might  help you.
results.name: Just Kicking it(Bad Habits) Meetup Group

results.description:
Perhaps the one habit that an overwhelming majority of successful people have in common is engaging in some kind of meditative practice. From billionaire investors, to elite athletes, to dating gurus, to gun-slinging entrepreneurs, meditation comes up again and again as a practice they attribute much of their success to. And yet, many young professionals in today's fast-paced world are turned off by the practice of meditation due to the strong religious connotations with which it is taught. 


My goal in this meetup group to to teach classes for the modern New Yorker. I will take traditional meditation and related practices (Zen meditation, Transcendental Meditation, Yoga Nidra, Pranayam) and attempt to teach them in a rigorous, scientific way, while maintaining their ancient and everlasting qualities. I plan to teach a number of courses, but the first will be a survey course that covers a few different types of practice. My goal here is to expose you to a range of different types of meditation so that you can choose one that suits you best. If you only attend this class and adopt the meditation type that works best for you, it will be well worth it.
results.name: Meditation for the Modern New Yorker

Locations for our meetings will vary according to what book we’re currently reading – ex: a book set near the ocean may inspire us to lunch at a beach. Occasionally we’re up for adventures beyond discussing books; we love to eat and drink, see a movie, get our spa on, take a salsa lesson, hit a comedy club or picnic in Central Park. Join us and let’s delve into our next book together!

Regards, Peaches and Angela H.

results.description:
I am a stay at home mom.I have three kids.2 years old son,8 years old daughter,10 years old son.I take of households,I take care of the kids.(Doctor appointments ,teacher conferences,homeworks,etc...)My days are full of chasing after hyper toddler who throws food ,yells at me and cries,my 8 years and 10 years old each others worst enemy. I am at the end of my tether and am totally sick of telling them to behave or leave each other alone. They hit,pinch ,verbally nasty each other and it is really upsetting to see them treat each other in this way.
Moms do a lot of work but do not get paid for it!Moms work 365 days a year with no sick time,vacation time or time paid off.!
I have never felt so heartbroken alone,poor,angry,isolated,worthless,unappreciated and miserable.
I have no friends.
I have no income.
I have been thinking,I should definitely do something with my life,I can not see my personal future clearly.
I just want to be me and worry about me.I want to find myself.I know ,I am not alone.I am so excited to start making friends and making time for myself.
results.name: Stay-At-Home Moms

Some workshops will show workflows from desktop GIS using QGIS to pushing the data to shareable web maps. Besides our open hours, CartoCampNYC will be teaching and hosting workshops and presentations on modern web mapping from the NYC community and beyond.

CartoCampNYC is a place for mappers to come and enjoy open hours with the CartoDB team and a central hub for information about upcoming CartoDB community events. For other great regular meetups in the city, checkout Maptime NYC, GeoNYC, and BetaNYC.

results.description:
Teach + Learn, Actually Networking.

We are a conscious community of professionals and entrepreneurs who freely share our resources and ourselves. Real conversations with people of all industries with one common goal: success through networking.

Members of our conscious community hold two principles true:

1)	Success at work and in business is measured by the quality of their connections, so they actively share access to information, resources, and contacts with other members of the community
2)	Success first begins with a focus on personal and professional development. We support each other through the improvement of our business and work skills.

No high pressure sales pitches or hidden agendas! Teach + Learn promotes RELATIONSHIP BUILDING instead of passing out business cards.

Professionals of all ages, abilities, and industries are WELCOME! We believe that the key to success is having people of all backgrounds in your network.

Our networking is FACILITATED. Make the most of your mingling with ice breakers and other activities to keep the conversation rolling.

Our community is free to join and even better when you participate in the conversation. Join us at an event or become part of our free secret Facebook page to have direct access to job posts, expert career advice, and professional development materials.

Looking forward to teaching and learning with you!
results.name: Teach + Learn: Manhattan Chapter

results.description: The Ridgewood Singers is a local community chorus looking for men and women who love to sing with a group. We have two performances a year, one in December and one in May. We rehearse every Monday night 7:30-9:30 at West Side Presbyterian Church in Ridgewood, N.J. beginning Mon. Sept. 14th. Dues are $55.00/concert season and each member is responsible for selling $60.00 worth of tickets/concert. You do not need to read music. So please come join our group and enjoy the pleasure of singing.

results.description: A weekly support group for new mothers led by a postpartum doula in her home. This group offers a confidential, comfortable space for mothers to share experiences, thoughts, and speak about the joys and struggles. A great way to meet new local moms who are looking to socialize with their newborns but weary of going to public spaces.  Coffee or tea is served along with one handed snacks, and on a nice day meeting will be held on the backyard patio.  Members are invited to either share their stories or simply provide an open ear while enjoying the company.  Every week we will cover a specific topic related to mothering.  Resources to local birth professionals, services, and helpful websites are available from the host if requested.

We are looking forward to meet regularly in New York City and hold conference calls, google hangouts, etc. for those that can't travel to the Big Apple.

Everyone is welcome to the group, Italian or not. Those that are not of Italian background to begin with will be considered for all extents and purposes (honorary) Italians.

results.description: This is a group for people who are seeking to evolve and expand in all aspects of their lives. Based on my own experience and by looking closely at the lives of other people around me, I firmly believe that by shifting our negative way of seeing a problem or situation to a more positive view, we become more creative and alert to find solutions to our problems or difficult situations and as a result our lives would improve dramatically. I created this group with the intention to meet with other like minded individuals who like me are looking to grow and expand, emotionally, financially and spiritually. Our meetings are going to take place twice at month the 1st and the 3rd Wednesday of each month from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. During our meetings all members are going to have the opportunity to share, to make questions and discuss current experiences, problems or any other life event they my be facing with the intention to seek deeper understanding, clarity and a possible solution. If you are truly and genuinely looking to evolve, to grow and to expand in all aspects of your life, this is the group for you to join.

Dinner beginning at 5:30 p.m., lessons on the opera "Tosca" from 6:30 - 7:30 p.m., dessert from 7:30 to 8:00 p.m. Excursion to Metropolitian Opera matinee on Oct. 24th at 1:00 p.m. followed by dinner at Angelina's Restaurant. Participants will receive a CD recording of Puccini's "Tosca" and round trip transportation will be arranged. Follow up celebration on Oct. 26th at Angelina's Restaurant to process the experience. Lessons will be presented by Professor Joan Adinolfi Mallory. Head of Music Education Department, Nyack College.

results.description:
Why Join: We help everyday people conquer their fears of real estate investing, so they can create a financially free future for themselves and their families.

Who should join: Anyone interested or curious about Real Estate Investing, anyone looking to improve their future, anyone already involved in Real Estate Investing.

What to expect: The support of a community, encouragement, motivation, education in Real Estate Investing, Free Workshops, events, all of your REI investing fears conquered.

Some topics of the workshop include:
How to pay 2/3 less in taxes each year
How to get a free car or house
How to get paid for taking a vacation
How to pay off your debt in less time and save money in interest.
How your children can graduate college debt-free.
Wholesaling (acquiring properties with little to no money down)
And so much more!

Class topics range from general health and body alignment to migraines, scoliosis, back pain, shoulder pain, walking issues, breathing, and stress just to name a few. Many people with auto-immune diseases such as Crohn's and arthritis can benefit greatly from these classes as well. Our goal is to heal the world of chronic pain so please come even if you don't see your ailment listed and we will work with you.

results.description: Calling all yogis new and seasoned! I'm new to the area and I'm a certified Yoga Instructor. I'd love to meet new people and enjoy the extraordinary parks we have in the Bayside area by bringing together like-minded folks to create community and connect with each other through the powerful practice of yoga!!! Yoga is great for relieving stress, dealing with anxiety, getting in shape and attuning to self awareness. The word yoga means "union" and often refers to uniting the breath and the body through breathing exercises and "asana" which are the postures used in the physical practice of yoga. And while connecting to our inner self is super important it's also essential to connect the world and people around us! I hope you'll join me as we celebrate the last weeks of summer with outdoor yoga classes! Each class will last about an hour. Please bring your own yoga mat, water (snacks if you want to stay after and eat) and whatever else you need to feel comfortable sitting and moving.

results.description:
This group supports the New Workforce through collaborative meetings, social gatherings, coworking field trips, and workshops & seminars. These are all focused on the mission to empower individuals to have complete control over their career and work-life, and to help change the way that companies hire. 

The New Workforce is a movement of individual independence. No matter how you work or who you work with, you can always work for yourself. Yes, even if you are an Employee!

At some point in all of our lives, we have been told that we can not do something that we want to do.  And sometimes, we believe it. The old-world career culture has conditioned us to live up to other people’s expectations and follow their rules, created by their opinions. 

The New Workforce is establishing our own rules & expectations. We consist of driven, creative, independent thinkers; that have a natural instinct to share knowledge, collaborate, learn, build and continue to grow.

Enjoyment for the work that we do is our number one goal.
results.name: The New Workforce

results.description: We are a women's chorus of about forty women, based on Long Island. If you can sing, and want to join a warm, talented, passionate, and fun group of singers, please take a look at our Join Us page. Our group has been rehearsing and performing for Long Island audiences for 52 years! We rehearse every week with our brilliant, talented and energetic Co-Directors, Christine Krowles and Connie Kash. They teach us our songs in many ways, for the different ways we learn, and help us to sound and look our best. If you like to sing, and would like to learn about barbershop singing, please give us a call. We rehearse every Thursday night from 7:15 until about 9:45 at the Good Shepherd Lutheran Church on Hempstead Turnpike in Levittown. Our chorus is not affiliated with the church - we just rent space. results.description:
We are looking to build a community of artist, of all ages and backgrounds, to come together and share their talents in a friendly, open and supportive environment. Our meetings will take place at St. Bartholomew's in White Plains, a beautiful 100 year old stone church with fantastic acoustics and beautiful stain glass windows. Each month a guest performer, (chosen from the membership) will open the show. This will be a great opportunity for some of our braver members to really show-off their talents. Then each musician, singer, poet, or comedian will have about 10 minutes to perform (depending on turn-out). A sound system and microphones will be provided.

So join us on the 3rd Wednesday of each month from 6 - 9pm, and play, sing, listen, laugh or just have a great time. All ages, old and young, beginner to advanced, are welcome so bring your friends and family.                                                        

A $2.00  suggested donation is requested to performer (to defray admin. fees).                                                Light fare and beverages will be on sale with a portion of the proceeds going to local charities.

results.description:
This meetup group can be described with 2 words : Serendipity + Francophilia !

Francophilia : for those who have learned (years ago) or are learning French and want to practice and improve their conversation skills in a fun and enjoyable way with native French speakers. Also for Francophone people visiting New York, it can be a nice way to discover the city and speak French with Americans/locals!

Serendipity : During nice weather, we might do things outdoors like : going for a hike upstate (e.g.: Cold Springs, the Croton Aqueduct ; walking along the Bronx River, the NJ Palisades or along the Walt Whitman trail...) ; or exploring landmarks in the city or special places like the Chinatown of Flushing, or Coney/City Island. We could also just meet in a beautiful place like the Cloisters, Governor's Island, Lyndhurst's Rose Garden or Untermeyer Park for a picnic, enjoy a sunset in a dramatic landscape, or watch an outdoor movie. In winter or rainy weather we could visit a wing of the MET or explore the art in the metro, or even just meet for a drink in a speakeasy bar. Any activity can be an « excuse » to practice your French in a non-formal setting. The idea is to practice conversation with diversified topics/environments and currents events, popular culture, politics, economics, news, etc. We can also discuss French literature and newspaper/magazine articles and editorials. For instance a visit to sites of the Harlem Renaissance or Columbia University or the Jumel Mansion could be an opportunity to enrich ourselves with our mutual histories, all while conversing in French!

I have plenty of places in mind for our Voyages ! Alors a bientôt !
results.name: French conversation in NY - An Invitation to the Voyage !
